analyzed: abhitas yūpam tiṣṭhantau juhutaḥ  yathā vai nāsikā evam yūpaḥ tasmāt ime abhitas
translated: They offer while standing on both sides of the stake.

analyzed: nāsikām cakṣuṣī
translated: The stake is as it were the nose: hence these eyes are on both sides of the nose.

original: tau vai vaṣaṭkṛtau santau mantreṇa hūyate /
analyzed: tau vai vaṣaṭkṛtau santau mantreṇa hūyate
translated: They offer while the Vashat has been uttered, and with a formula.

analyzed: etena u ha etau tat udaśnuvāte yat enau
translated: By this (formula) they reach that (offering) of theirs,

original: sarvaṃ savanamanuhūyate yadvevaitau sarvaṃ savanamanuhūyata etau vai prajāpateḥ
analyzed: sarvam savanam anuhūyate yat u eva etau sarvam savanam anuhūyate etau vai prajāpateḥ
translated: to which they are invited throughout the whole Soma-sacrifice. And, again, as to why they are invited throughout the whole Soma-sacrifice;--these two, doubtless, are the eyes of Pragâpati;

original: pratyakṣatamāṃ cakṣuṣī hyetau satyaṃ vai cakṣuḥ satyaṃ hi prajāpatistasmādenau
analyzed: pratyakṣatamām cakṣuṣī hi etau satyam vai cakṣuḥ satyam hi prajāpatiḥ tasmāt enau
translated: For these two eyes are the most evident, and the eye is truth, and Prajapati is truth; therefore these two

analyzed: sarvam savanam anuhūyate
translated: are invoked at all the Soma-pressings.

original: sa juhoti / sa prathamā saṃskṛtirviśvavārā sa prathamo varuṇo mitro agniḥ sa
analyzed: sa juhoti sa prathamā saṃskṛtiḥ viśva vārā sa prathamaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ sa
translated: He offers. He is the first creation, the bestower of all boons, he is the first Varuna, Mitra, Agni,

analyzed: prathamaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ cikitvān tasmai indrāya sutam ājuhota svāhā iti
translated: he is the first wise Brihaspati. To him Indra, offer the first pressed (Soma), Svâhâ!

analyzed: sa yat juhoti
translated: When he offers.

original: sā prathamā sa prathama iti śaśvaddha vai retasaḥ siktasya cakṣuṣī eva
analyzed: sā prathamā sa prathamaḥ iti śaśvat ha vai retasaḥ siktasya cakṣuṣī eva
translated: The first, the first. For the eyes of the seed that has been shed are the first

analyzed: prathame sambhavataḥ tasmāt juhoti sā prathamā iti
translated: to be formed. Therefore he offers, The first, the first.

original: atha sampreṣyati /🔽praitu hotuścamasaḥ pra brahmaṇaḥ prodgātṝṇām pra
analyzed: atha sampreṣyati  praitu hotuḥ camasaḥ pra brahmaṇaḥ pra udgātṝṇām pra
translated: Then he gives the order.

original: yajamānasya prayantu sadasyānāṃ hotrāṇāṃ camasādhvaryava upāvartadhvaṃ🔽śukrasyābhyunnayadhvamiti sampraiṣa evaiṣa paryetya pratiprasthātādhvaryoḥ pātre
analyzed: yajamānasya prayantu sadasyānām hotrāṇām camasādhvaryavaḥ upāvartadhvam  śukrasya abhyunnayadhvam iti sampraiṣaḥ eva eṣa paryetya pratiprasthātā adhvaryoḥ pātre
translated: Let the Hotri's goblet go forward, let the Brahman's go forward, let the Udgâtri's go forward, let the sacrificer's go forward. Let the members of the sacrificial body and the Hotrakas go forward. Turn ye to the Sukra (cup).🔽 Raise it up, this is the order. Having gone round behind, the Pratiprasthâtri pours the residue into the Adhvaryu's vessel. He (the Adhvaryu) takes the first portion of the oblation and carries it to the Hotri's goblet.

analyzed: saṃsravam avanayati attre eva etat ādyam balim hārayati tam adhvaryuḥ hotṛ camase
translated: The Adhvaryu takes the first portion of the oblation and carries it to the Hotri's goblet.

original: 'vanayati bhakṣāya vaṣaṭkarturhi bhakṣaḥ prāṇo vai vaṣaṭkāraḥ so
analyzed: vanayati bhakṣāya vaṣaṭkartuḥ hi bhakṣaḥ prāṇaḥ vai vaṣaṭkāraḥ saḥ
translated: 'He pours it down for the sake of eating, for the eater is he who says Vashat; the Vashat-call is the breath,

analyzed: smāt etat vaṣaṭkurvataḥ parāṅ iva abhūt prāṇaḥ vai bhakṣaḥ tat prāṇam punarātman dhatte
translated: it has gone away from him who has said Vashat; the eater is the breath; he thus puts the breath back into himself.'

original: atha yadete pratīcī pātre na haranti /
analyzed: atha yat ete pratīcī pātre na haranti
translated: And as to why they do not carry the two (cups) towards the west,

analyzed: haranti anyān grahān cakṣuṣī hi ete
translated: (but) carry the other cups, it is because these two are the eyes.

analyzed: saṃsravam eva hotṛ camase vanayati
translated: He pours the residue into the Hotri's cup.

analyzed: atha hotrāṇām camasān abhyunnayanti
translated: Then they raise the cups of the Hotri priests.

analyzed: huta uciṣṭāḥ vai ete saṃsravāḥ bhavanti
translated: They are the residue of the offerings,

analyzed: na alam āhutyai tān eva etat punar āpyāyayanti tathā alam āhutyai bhavanti tasmāt hotrāṇām  camasān abhyunnayanti
translated: and are not sufficient for the offering; they thus make them swell again, and they become sufficient for the offering; therefore🔽they raise the cups of the Hotri priests.

analyzed: atha hotrāḥ saṃyājayanti
translated: Then they perform the Samyâgyâ for the Hotri priests.

original: hotrā ha vai yuktā devebhyo yajñaṃ vahanti tā🔽evaitatsaṃtarpayanti tṛptāḥ prītā devebhyo yajñaṃ vahāniti tasmāddhotrāḥ
analyzed: hotrāḥ ha vai yuktāḥ devebhyaḥ yajñam vahanti tāḥ  eva etat saṃtarpayanti tṛptāḥ prītāḥ devebhyaḥ yajñam vahān iti tasmāt hotrāḥ
translated: The Hotri priests, yoked, carry the sacrifice to the gods;

analyzed: saṃyājayanti  sa prathamāyām vā hotrāyām
translated: they thus gratify them, thinking, 'Gratified and pleased, may they carry the sacrifice to the gods!' therefore they perform the Samyâgyâ for the Hotri priests.🔽He either consecrates (the sacrificer) after the first Hotri priest has offered,

analyzed: iṣṭāyām uttamāyām vā anumantrayate tṛmpantu hotrā
translated: or after the last has offered, thinking, 'May the Hotri priests be satisfied,🔽may they be pleased, and carry the sacrifice to the gods!' therefore he consecrates (the sacrificer) after the first Hotri priest has offered,🔽or after the last has offered.

original: madhvo yāḥ sviṣṭā yāḥ suprītāḥ suhutā yatsvāheti hotrāṇāmevaiṣā tṛptirathetya
analyzed: madhvaḥ yāḥ su iṣṭāḥ yāḥ su prītāḥ su hutāḥ yat svāhā iti hotrāṇām eva eṣā tṛptiḥ atha itya
translated: 'The well-offered, the well-pleased, the well-sacrificed, the svâhâs', this is the satisfaction of the oblations. Then 'the ghee', 'the butter', 'the oil', 'the milk', 'the curds', 'the water', 'the food', 'the flesh', 'the drink', 'the honey', 'the sweet', 'the well-offered', 'the well-pleased', 'the well-sacrificed', 'the svâhâs';

analyzed: pratyaṅ upaviśati ayāṭ agnīdh iti agnīdh hi atra yajatām uttamaḥ saṃyajati
translated: 'The sweet ones, well-offered, well-pleased, well-sacrificed, what svâhâ!' This is the satisfaction of the oblations. Then 'Come hither, O Agni!' For Agni is the last of the sacrificers to sacrifice here;

analyzed: tasmāt āha āyāṭ agnīdh iti
translated: therefore he says, 'Come hither, O Agni.'

original: ātmā ha vā asyāgrayaṇaḥ /🔽so 'syaiṣa sarvameva sarvaṃ hyayamātmā tasmādanayā🔽gṛhṇātyasyai hi sthālī bhavati sthālyā hyenaṃ gṛhṇāti sarvaṃ vā iyaṃ sarvameṣa
analyzed: ātmā ha vai asya āgrayaṇaḥ  sa u sya eṣa sarvam eva sarvam hi ayam ātmā tasmāt anayā  gṛhṇāti asyai hi sthālī bhavati sthālyā hi enam gṛhṇāti sarvam vai iyam sarvam eṣa
translated: The Âgrayana (graha) is his (Yagña's) self;🔽and this (Âgrayana) is everything to him, for this self is everything: therefore he draws it with this (cup), for this (earth) is its vessel; for in a vessel he draws it. Everything, this (earth), is this graha;

analyzed: grahaḥ tasmāt anayā gṛhṇāti
translated: therefore he draws it with this (earth).

analyzed: pūrṇam gṛhṇāti
translated: He draws it full;

original: sarvaṃ vai pūrṇaṃ sarvameṣa grahastasmātpūrṇaṃ gṛhṇāti / / /
analyzed: sarvam vai pūrṇam sarvam eṣa grahaḥ tasmāt pūrṇam gṛhṇāti
translated: for the full means everything, and this graha is everything: therefore he draws it full.

original: viśvebhyo devebhyo gṛhṇāti /🔽sarvaṃ vai viśve devāḥ sarvameṣa
analyzed: viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ gṛhṇāti  sarvam vai viśve devāḥ sarvam eṣa
translated: He draws it for the Visve Devâh;

analyzed: grahaḥ tasmāt viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ gṛhṇāti
translated: for the Visve Devâh are everything, and this graha is everything: therefore he draws it for the Visve Devâh.

original: sarveṣu savaneṣu gṛhṇāti /🔽sarvaṃ vai savanāni sarvameṣa grahastasmātsarveṣu
analyzed: sarveṣu savaneṣu gṛhṇāti  sarvam vai savanāni sarvam eṣa grahaḥ tasmāt sarveṣu
translated: He draws it at all the pressings;

analyzed: savaneṣu gṛhṇāti
translated: for the pressings are everything, and this graha is everything: therefore he draws it at all the pressings.

analyzed: sa yadi rājā upadasyet
translated: If he were to go to the king,

original: tamata eva tanvīrannataḥ prabhāvayeyurātmā vā āgrayaṇa
analyzed: tam atas eva tanvīran atas prabhāvayeyuḥ ātmā vai āgrayaṇa
translated: They would make it to be just that, they would make it to be powerful. The Āgrayana is the self,

original: ātmano vā imāni sarvāṇyaṅgāni prabhavantyetasmādantato hāriyojanaṃ grahaṃ gṛhṇāti
analyzed: ātmanaḥ vai imāni sarvāṇi aṅgāni prabhavanti etasmāt antatas hāriyojanam graham gṛhṇāti
translated: from the self all these limbs proceed. From it, at the end, he draws the Hāriyojana cup.

analyzed: tad ātmani eva asyām pratiṣṭhāyām antatas yajñaḥ pratitiṣṭhati
translated: In the self, in this foundation, the sacrifice finds support at the end.

analyzed: atha yasmāt āgrayaṇaḥ nāma
translated: Now as to why it is called Āgrayana.

original: yāṃ vā amūṃ grāvāṇamādadāno vācaṃ yacatyatra vai
analyzed: yām vai amūm grāvāṇam ādadānaḥ vācam yacati atra vai
translated: When he takes that stone, he restrains speech. There

analyzed: sā agre vadat tat yat sā atra agre vadat tasmāt āgrayaṇaḥ nāma
translated: she spoke first. Because she spoke first there, it is called Āgrayana.

analyzed: rakṣobhyaḥ vai tām bhīṣā vācam ayacan
translated: They restrained speech out of fear of the Raksases.

analyzed: ṣaṭ vai atas prācaḥ grahān gṛhṇāti atha eṣa
translated: He draws six cups from here to the east, then this

original: saptamaḥ ṣaḍvā ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarasya sarvaṃ vai saṃvatsaraḥ / / /
analyzed: saptamaḥ ṣaṭ vai ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarasya sarvam vai saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: is the seventh. There are six seasons in the year, the year is everything.🔽The gods, when everything was conquered, when there was no fear, no danger,

original: tāṃ devāḥ / sarvasminvijite 'bhaye 'nāṣṭre 'trāgre vācamavadaṃstatho evaiṣa etāṃ
analyzed: tām devāḥ sarvasmin vijite bhaye nāṣṭre tra agre vācam avadan tathā u eva eṣaḥ etām
translated: spoke first here. In the same way, he,

analyzed: sarvasmin vijite bhaye nāṣṭre tra agre vācam vadati
translated: when everything is conquered, when there is no fear, no danger, speaks first here.

analyzed: atha atas gṛhṇāti eva
translated: Now then he draws (the cup).

original: ye devāso divyekādaśa stha pṛthivyāmadhyekādaśa stha apsukṣito
analyzed: ye devāsaḥ divi ekādaśa stha pṛthivyām adhi ekādaśa stha apsukṣitaḥ
translated: Ye gods who are eleven in heaven, who are eleven in the middle of the earth, who are in the waters,

original: mahinaikādaśa stha te devāso yajñamimaṃ juṣadhvam upayāmagṛhīto 'syāgrayaṇo 'si
analyzed: mahinā ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ yajñam imam juṣadhvam upayāma gṛhītaḥ sya āgrayaṇaḥ si
translated: 'O ye eleven gods, rejoice in this sacrifice of mine.' 'Thou art taken with a support; thou art the first-pressed of this (Soma).'

original: svāgrayaṇa iti vācamevaitadayātayāmnīṃ karoti tasmādanayā samānaṃ sadviparyāsaṃ🔽vadatyajāmitāyai jāmi ha kuryādyadāgrayaṇo 'syāgrayaṇo 'sīti
analyzed: su āgrayaṇaḥ iti vācam eva etat ayātayāmnīm karoti tasmāt anayā samānam sat viparyāsam  vadati ajāmitāyai jāmi ha kuryāt yat āgrayaṇaḥ sya āgrayaṇaḥ sīti
translated: 'Thou art the good first-pressed,' he says; he makes speech not to be deficient; therefore, though the same, it speaks in a different way.

analyzed: gṛhṇīyāt tasmāt āha āgrayaṇaḥ si su āgrayaṇaḥ iti
translated: For non-kinship; he would cause kinship if he were to take (Soma) with 'Thou art the first-pressed of this (Soma),' therefore he says, 'Thou art the first-pressed, thou art the good first-pressed.'

original: pāhi yajñam pāhi yajñapatimiti /🔽vācamevaitadutsṛṣṭāmāha gopāya yajñamiti pāhi
analyzed: pāhi yajñam pāhi yajñapatim iti  vācam eva etat utsṛṣṭām āha gopāya yajñam iti pāhi
translated: 'Protect the sacrifice, protect the lord of the sacrifice,' he says;

original: yajñapatimiti vācamevaitadutsṛṣṭāmāha gopāya yajamānamiti yajamāno hi🔽yajñapatirviṣṇustvāmindriyeṇa pātu viṣṇuṃ tvam pāhīti vācamevaitadutsṛṣṭāmāha🔽yajño vai viṣṇuryajñastvāṃ vīryeṇa gopāyatviti viṣṇuṃ tvam pāhīti
analyzed: yajñapatim iti vācam eva etat utsṛṣṭām āha gopāya yajamānam iti yajamānaḥ hi  yajñapatiḥ viṣṇuḥ tvām indriyeṇa pātu viṣṇum tvam pāhi iti vācam eva etat utsṛṣṭām āha  yajñaḥ vai viṣṇuḥ yajñaḥ tvām vīryeṇa gopāyatu iti viṣṇum tvam pāhi iti
translated: he means to say to speech when it is let loose, 'Guard the sacrifice.' 'Protect the lord of the sacrifice,' he says;🔽he means to say to speech when it is let loose, 'Guard the sacrificer.' For the sacrificer is the lord of the sacrifice. 'May Vishnu guard thee with his power; guard thou Vishnu,' he says;

original: vācamevaitadutsṛṣṭāmāha yajñaṃ tvaṃ gopāyetyabhi savanāni pāhīti tadetaṃ
analyzed: vācam eva etat utsṛṣṭām āha yajñam tvam gopāya iti abhi savanāni pāhi iti tat etam
translated: he means to say to speech when it is let loose, 'May the sacrifice guard thee with its power; guard thou the sacrifice.' 'Guard the pressings,' he says;

analyzed: graham āha sarvāṇi hi eṣa savanāni prati
translated: he means to say to the cup, 'For all the pressings are contained in this cup.'

analyzed: atha daśāpavitram upagṛhya hiṅkaroti
translated: He then takes the ten-knotted (pavitra), and utters the syllable 'Him'.

original: sā haiṣā vāganudyamānā tatāma tasyāṃ devā🔽vāci tāntāyāṃ hiṅkāreṇaiva prāṇamadadhuḥ prāṇo vai hiṅkāraḥ prāṇo hi vai
analyzed: sā ha eṣā vāc an udyamānā tatāma tasyām devā  vāci tāntāyām hiṅkāreṇa eva prāṇam adadhuḥ prāṇaḥ vai hiṅkāraḥ prāṇaḥ hi vai
translated: That speech, when not uttered, was stretched out. The gods,🔽in that speech, when stretched out, by means of the syllable 'Him' alone, gave it breath. The syllable 'Him' is breath,

original: hiṅkārastasmādapigṛhya nāsike na hiṅkartuṃ śaknoti saitena prāṇena samajihīta yadā
analyzed: hiṅkāraḥ tasmāt apigṛhya nāsike na hiṅkartum śaknoti sā etena prāṇena samajihīta yadā
translated: for the syllable 'Him' is breath. Therefore, when one has closed his nostrils, he is not able to utter the syllable 'Him'. It was united with that breath.

original: vai tāntaḥ prāṇaṃ labhate 'tha sa saṃjihīte tatho evaiṣa etadvāci tāntāyāṃ hiṅkāreṇaiva
analyzed: vai tāntaḥ prāṇam labhate sa saṃjihīte tathā u eva eṣa etat vāci tāntāyām hiṅkāreṇa eva
translated: When one obtains breath within, then he is united. In the same way, he, in that speech, when stretched out, by means of the syllable 'Him' alone,

original: prāṇaṃ dadhāti saitena prāṇena saṃjihīte triṣkṛtvo hiṅkaroti trivṛddhi yajñaḥ / / /
analyzed: prāṇam dadhāti sa etena prāṇena saṃjihīte triṣkṛtvaḥ hiṅkaroti trivṛt hi yajñaḥ
translated: gives it breath. It is united with that breath. When he is united, then he is able to utter the syllable 'Him'. He utters the syllable 'Him' three times. The sacrifice is threefold.

analyzed: atha āha somaḥ pavate iti
translated: He then says, 'Soma is purified.'

analyzed: sa yām eva amūm bhīṣā asurarakṣasebhyaḥ na
translated: That which he did not utter out of fear of the Asuras and Rakshasas,

analyzed: nirabruvan tām eva etat sarvasmin vijite bhaye nāṣṭre tra nirāha tām āviṣkaroti
translated: that he now utters here, in all that is conquered, in what is free from danger and misfortune. He makes it manifest.

original: tasmādāha somaḥ pavata iti / / /🔽asmai brahmaṇe 'smai kṣatrāyeti /
analyzed: tasmāt āha somaḥ pavate iti  asmai brahmaṇe smai kṣatrāya iti
translated: Therefore he says, 'Soma is purified.'🔽'For this Brahman, for this Kshatra,'

analyzed: tat brahmaṇe ca kṣatrāya ca āha asmai sunvate
translated: he says that for the Brahman and the Kshatra. 'For this sacrificer who is pressing,'

analyzed: yajamānāya pavate iti tat yajamānāya āha
translated: he says that for the sacrificer.

original: tadāhuḥ / etāvadevoktvā sādayedetāvadvā idaṃ sarvaṃ yāvadbrahma kṣatraṃ
analyzed: tat āhuḥ etāvat eva uktvā sādayet etāvat vai idam sarvam yāvat brahma kṣatram
translated: As to this they say, 'Having said so much, he should deposit (the cup); for so much is this All, to wit, the Brahman, the Kshatra,

original: viḍindrāgnī vā idaṃ sarvaṃ tasmādetāvadevoktvā sādayediti / / /
analyzed: viś indra agnī vai idam sarvam tasmāt etāvat eva uktvā sādayet iti
translated: the Vis, Indra and Agni: this All is that. Therefore, having said so much, he should deposit (the cup).'

original: tadu brūyādeva bhūyaḥ /🔽iṣa ūrje pavata iti vṛṣṭyai tadāha yadāheṣa ityūrja iti yo
analyzed: tat u brūyāt eva bhūyaḥ  iṣe ūrje pavate iti vṛṣṭyai tat āha yat āha iṣe iti ūrje iti yaḥ
translated: Let him, nevertheless, say more.🔽'For food and strength he purifies himself,' he says; for rain he says that, when he says 'for food,' for from the rain food is produced;

original: vṛṣṭādūrgraso jāyate tasmai tadāhādbhya oṣadhībhyaḥ pavata iti🔽tadadbhyaścauṣadhībhyaścāha dyāvāpṛthivībhyām pavata iti tadābhyāṃ
analyzed: vṛṣṭāt ūrgrasaḥ jāyate tasmai tat āha adbhyaḥ oṣadhībhyaḥ pavate iti  tat adbhyaḥ ca oṣadhībhyaḥ ca āha dyāvāpṛthivībhyām pavate iti tat ābhyām
translated: 'for him,' he says; 'for the waters and plants he purifies himself,' he says;🔽for the waters and plants he says that, for on them this All rests. 'For heaven and earth he purifies himself,' he says;🔽for heaven and earth he says that, for in them this All rests. 'For the well-made (he purifies himself),' he says; 'for the good (he purifies himself),' he says;

original: dyāvāpṛthivībhyāmāha yayoridaṃ sarvamadhi subhūtāya pavata iti sādhave pavata
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivībhyām āha yayoḥ idam sarvam adhi subhūtāya pavate iti sādhave pavata
translated: that is, for the prosperous (he purifies himself), he thereby says.

original: ityevaitadāha / / /🔽tadu haika āhuḥ /🔽brahmavarcasāya pavata iti tadu tathā na brūyādyadvā āhāsmai🔽brahmaṇa iti tadeva brahmavarcasāyāha viśvebhyastvā devebhya eṣa te
analyzed: iti eva etat āha  tat u ha eke āhuḥ  brahmavarcasāya pavate iti tat u tathā na brūyāt yat vai āha asmai  brahmaṇe iti tat eva brahmavarcasāya āha viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ eṣa te
translated: As to this, however, some say,

original: yonirviśvebhyastvā devebhya iti sādayati viśvebhyo hyenaṃ devebhyo gṛhṇāti taṃ vai
analyzed: yoniḥ viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ iti sādayati viśvebhyaḥ hi enam devebhyaḥ gṛhṇāti tam vai

analyzed: saḥ etasmāt mithunāt prajananāt ṛtūn saṃvatsaram prajanayati  yat u eva sanne cāvāke
translated: From that pair, that generation, he generates the seasons, the year.

analyzed: ṛtu grahaiḥ carati sarvam vai ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: And, again, why he performs the ṛtu-graha libations when the Âkâvâka has eaten;--the seasons are the whole year:

original: sarvamevaitatprajanayati tasmātsanne 'cāvāka ṛtugrahaiścarati / / /🔽tānvai dvādaśa gṛhṇīyāt /🔽dvādaśa vai māsāḥ saṃvatsarasya tasmāddvādaśa
analyzed: sarvam eva etat prajanayati tasmāt sanne cāvāke ṛtu grahaiḥ carati  tān vai dvādaśa gṛhṇīyāt  dvādaśa vai māsāḥ saṃvatsarasya tasmāt dvādaśa
translated: he thus generates the whole; therefore he performs the ṛtu-graha libations when the Âkâvâka has eaten.

original: gṛhṇīyādatho api trayodaśa gṛhṇīyādasti trayodaśo māsa iti dvādaśa tveva🔽gṛhṇīyādeṣaiva sampat / / /
analyzed: gṛhṇīyāt atha u api trayodaśa gṛhṇīyāt asti trayodaśaḥ māsaḥ iti dvādaśa tu eva  gṛhṇīyāt eṣā eva sampad
translated: He should draw them twelve times; for there are twelve months in the year: therefore he should draw them twelve times. But he may also draw them thirteen times, thinking 'there is a thirteenth month.' Twelve times, however, he should draw them; for that is the perfection.

analyzed: droṇakalaśāt gṛhṇāti
translated: He draws them from the Dronakalasa (graduated vessel).

analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai droṇakalaśaḥ saḥ etasmāt prajāpateḥ ṛtūn saṃvatsaram  prajanayati
translated: The Dronakalasa is Pragâpati: from that Pragâpati he generates the seasons, the year.

analyzed: ubhayatas mukhābhyām pātrābhyām gṛhṇāti
translated: He draws (the Soma) with two cups, the mouths of which look in opposite directions.

analyzed: kutas tayoḥ antāḥ ye ubhayatas mukhe
translated: How then could there be an end to them, whose mouths look in opposite directions?

original: tasmādayamantaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ pariplavate taṃ gṛhītvā na sādayati tasmādayamasannaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt ayam antar saṃvatsaraḥ pariplavate tam gṛhītvā na sādayati tasmāt ayam asannaḥ
translated: Hence this year rolls on without stopping; and having drawn it (the Soma), he does not deposit it: hence this year is not deposited.

analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: The year is indeed the same as that (Soma).

analyzed: na anuvākyām anvāha
translated: He does not utter an invitatory prayer,

original: hvayati vā anuvākyayāgato hyevāyamṛturyadi divā yadi naktaṃ
analyzed: hvayati vai anuvākyayā āgataḥ hi eva ayam ṛtuḥ yadi divā yadi naktam
translated: for the season is already come, whether it be by day or by night.

original: nānuvaṣaṭkaroti nedṛtūnavavṛṇajā iti sahaiva prathamau grahau gṛhṇītaḥ🔽sahottamāvidamevaitatsarvaṃ saṃvatsareṇa parigṛhṇītastadidaṃ sarvaṃ saṃvatsareṇa
analyzed: na anuvaṣaṭkaroti na id ṛtūn avavṛṇajai iti saha eva prathamau grahau gṛhṇītaḥ  saha uttamau idam eva etat sarvam saṃvatsareṇa parigṛhṇītaḥ tat idam sarvam saṃvatsareṇa
translated: He does not utter a second Vashat, lest he should cut off the seasons: the first two cups he draws together,

analyzed: parigṛhītam
translated: and the last two together; and thus they enclose this All within the year: hence this All is enclosed within the year.

original: nirevānyataraḥ krāmati /🔽prānyataraḥ padyate tasmādime 'nvañco māsā yantyatha
analyzed: niḥ eva anyataraḥ krāmati  pra anyataraḥ padyate tasmāt ime nu añcaḥ māsāḥ yanti atha
translated: One of them goes out,

original: yadubhau vā saha niṣkrāmetāmubhau vā saha prapadyeyātām pṛthagu haiveme māsā
analyzed: yat ubhau vā saha niṣkrāmetām ubhau vā saha prapadyeyātām pṛthak u ha eva ime māsā
translated: and the other steps forward: hence the months go on in succession. But were both of them to go out together, or were both of them to step forward together, then these months would be separate,🔽and not in succession.

analyzed: īyuḥ tasmāt niḥ eva anyataraḥ krāmati pra anyataraḥ padyate
translated: Therefore one of them goes out, the other enters.

analyzed: tau vai ṛtunā iti ṣaṭ pracarataḥ
translated: They perform six times with 'By the season' (they perform).

analyzed: tat devāḥ ahar asṛjanta ṛtubhiḥ iti catuḥ tat rātrim asṛjanta
translated: The gods created the day with that, and with the seasons they created the night.

analyzed: sa yat ha etāvat eva abhaviṣyat rātriḥ ha eva abhaviṣyat na vyayavatsyat
translated: If it had been only that much, it would have been only night, it would not have passed away.

analyzed: tau vai ṛtunā iti upariṣṭāt dvis carataḥ tat devāḥ
translated: They perform twice afterwards with 'By the season' (they perform). The gods

original: purastādaharadadustasmādidamadyāharatha rātriratha śvo 'harbhavitā / / /🔽ṛtuneti vai devāḥ /🔽manuṣyānasṛjantartubhiriti paśūntsa yattanmadhye yena
analyzed: purastāt ahar adaduḥ tasmāt idam adya ahar atha rātriḥ atha śvas har bhavitā  ṛtunā iti vai devāḥ  manuṣyān asṛjanta ṛtubhiḥ iti paśūn sa yat tat madhye yena
translated: placed the day in front with that, therefore today is the day, then the night, and tomorrow the day will be.🔽The gods created men with 'By the season' (they perform), and with the seasons they created the animals. Since they created the animals in the middle with that,

original: paśūnasṛjanta tasmādime paśava ubhayataḥ parigṛhītā vaśamupetā manuṣyāṇām / / /
analyzed: paśūn asṛjanta tasmāt ime paśavaḥ ubhayatas parigṛhītāḥ vaśam upetāḥ manuṣyāṇām
translated: therefore these animals are surrounded on both sides, subject to the control of men.

original: tau vā ṛtuneti ṣaṭ pracarya /🔽itarathā pātre viparyasyete ṛtubhiriti catuścaritvetarathā
analyzed: tau vai ṛtunā iti ṣaṭ pracarya  itarathā pātre viparyasyete ṛtubhiḥ iti catuḥ caritvā itarathā
translated: Having performed six times with 'By the season' (they perform),

original: pātre viparyasyete anyatarata eva taddevā aharasṛjantānyatarato rātrimanyatarata eva
analyzed: pātre viparyasyete anyataratas eva tat devāḥ ahar asṛjanta anyataratas rātrim anyataratas eva
translated: they turn the vessels over in the other direction. Having performed four times with 'By the seasons' (they perform), they turn the vessels over in the other direction. With that the gods created the day on one side, the night on the other side. With that the gods

analyzed: tat devāḥ manuṣyān asṛjanta anyataratas paśūn
translated: created men on one side, animals on the other side.

analyzed: atha atas gṛhṇāti eva
translated: Now then he takes (the Soma) as follows.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si madhave🔽tvetyevādhvaryurgṛhṇātyupayāmagṛhīto 'si mādhavāya tveti pratiprasthātaitāveva🔽vāsantikau sa yadvasanta oṣadhayo jāyante vanaspatayaḥ pacyante teno haitau
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ si madhave  tvā iti eva adhvaryuḥ gṛhṇāti upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si mādhavāya tvā iti pratiprasthātā etau eva  vāsantikau sa yat vasante oṣadhayaḥ jāyante vanaspatayaḥ pacyante tena u ha etau
translated: 'Thou art taken with a support: thee to Madhu',

analyzed: madhuḥ ca mādhavaḥ ca  upayāma gṛhītaḥ si  śukrāya tvā iti eva adhvaryuḥ gṛhṇāti upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si śucaye tvā iti
translated: thus the Adhvaryu takes (the cup); 'thou art taken with a support: thee to Madhava', thus the Pratiprasthâtri. These two belong to the spring season. In that in spring the plants spring up and the trees ripen, therefore these two are Madhu and Madhava.

original: pratiprasthātaitāveva graiṣmau sa yadetayorbaliṣṭhaṃ tapati teno haitau śukraśca🔽śuciśca / / /🔽upayāmagṛhīto 'si nabhase tvetyevādhvaryurgṛhṇātyupayāmagṛhīto 'si nabhasyāya🔽tveti pratiprasthātaitāveva vārṣikāvamuto vai divo varṣati teno haitau nabhaśca
analyzed: pratiprasthātā etau eva graiṣmau sa yat etayoḥ baliṣṭham tapati tena u ha etau śukraḥ ca  śuciḥ ca  upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si nabhase tvā iti eva adhvaryuḥ gṛhṇāti upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si nabhasyāya  tvā iti pratiprasthātā etau eva vārṣikau amutas vai divaḥ varṣati tena u ha etau nabhaḥ ca
translated: 'Thou art taken with a support: thee to Sukra', thus the Adhvaryu takes (the cup); 'thou art taken with a support: thee to Suki,' thus the Pratiprasthâtri. These two belong to the summer season. In that by these two the strongest heat is produced, therefore these two are Sukra and Suki.

analyzed: nabhasyaḥ ca  upayāma gṛhītaḥ si
translated: 'Thou art taken with a support: thee to Nabhas,' thus the Adhvaryu takes (the cup); 'thou art taken with a support: thee to Nabhasya,' thus the Pratiprasthâtri. These two belong to the rainy season. From yonder sky it rains here: therefore these two are Nabhas and Nabhasya.

analyzed: iṣe tvā iti eva adhvaryuḥ gṛhṇāti upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si ūrje tvā iti
translated: 'Thou art taken with a support: thee to Ishanâ,' thus the Adhvaryu takes (the cup); 'thou art taken with a support: thee to Urjâ,' thus the Pratiprasthâtri. These two belong to the autumn season. In that in autumn the food ripens, therefore these two are Ishanâ and Urjâ.

original: pratiprasthātaitāveva śāradau sa yacaradyūrgrasa oṣadhayaḥ pacyante teno
analyzed: pratiprasthātā etau eva śāradau sa yat carat yūrgrasaḥ oṣadhayaḥ pacyante tena u
translated: The Pratiprasthātṛ takes these two autumn ones. In that the ripe crops are eaten in autumn,

analyzed: ha etau iṣaḥ ca ūrjaḥ ca
translated: therefore these two are Sahama and Urja.

analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si sahase tvā iti eva adhvaryuḥ gṛhṇāti upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si sahasyāya tvā iti
translated: The Adhvaryu takes it with Thou art taken with a support; for Sahas thou! The Pratiprasthātṛ with Thou art taken with a support; for Sahasyâya thou!

original: pratiprasthātaitāveva haimantikau sa yaddhemanta imāḥ prajāḥ sahaseva svaṃ
analyzed: pratiprasthātā etau eva haimantikau sa yat hemante imāḥ prajāḥ sahasā iva svam
translated: These two are the winter ones. In that in winter these creatures are brought under their own control as it were by cold,

analyzed: vaśam upanayate tena u ha etau sahaḥ ca sahasyaḥ ca
translated: therefore these two are Saha and Sahasya.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si tapase tvetyevādhvaryurgṛhṇātyupayāmagṛhīto 'si tapasyāya tveti🔽pratiprasthātaitāveva śaiśirau sa yadetayorbaliṣṭhaṃ śyāyati teno haitau tapaśca
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si tapase tvā iti eva adhvaryuḥ gṛhṇāti upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si tapasyāya tvā iti  pratiprasthātā etau eva śaiśirau sa yat etayoḥ baliṣṭham śyāyati tena u ha etau tapaḥ ca
translated: The Adhvaryu takes it with Thou art taken with a support; for Tapas thou! The Pratiprasthātṛ with Thou art taken with a support; for Tapyas thou!

analyzed: tapasyaḥ ca  upayāmi gṛhītaḥ si
translated: These two are the snowy ones. In that by these two the strongest freezes, therefore these two are Tapas and Tapyas.🔽The Adhvaryu takes it with Thou art taken with a support; for Aṃhasaspati thou! The Pratiprasthātṛ with Thou art taken with a support; for Aṃhasaspati thou!

original: aṃhasaspataye tveti trayodaśaṃ grahaṃ gṛhṇāti yadi trayodaśaṃ🔽gṛhṇīyādatha pratiprasthātādhvaryoḥ pātre saṃsravamavanayatyadhvaryurvā
analyzed: aṃhasaspataye tvā iti trayodaśam graham gṛhṇāti yadi trayodaśam  gṛhṇīyāt atha pratiprasthātā adhvaryoḥ pātre saṃsravam avanayati adhvaryuḥ vā
translated: If he is to take a thirteenth libation,

analyzed: pratiprasthātuḥ pātre saṃsravam avanayati āharati bhakṣam
translated: then the Pratiprasthātṛ pours the residue into the Adhvaryu's vessel; or the Adhvaryu pours the residue into the Pratiprasthātṛ's vessel. He brings the cup for the consumption.

analyzed: atha pratiprasthātā a bhakṣitena pātreṇa
translated: Then the Pratiprasthātṛ with the vessel from which he has not eaten,

original: aindrāgnaṃ grahaṃ gṛhṇāti🔽tadyadabhakṣitena pātreṇaindrāgnaṃ grahaṃ gṛhṇāti na vā
analyzed: aindrāgnam graham gṛhṇāti  tat yat a bhakṣitena pātreṇa aindrāgnam graham gṛhṇāti na vā
translated: Now the Pratiprasthâtri, with the vessel which has not been used, draws the cup for Indra and Agni.🔽The reason why he draws the cup for Indra and Agni with the vessel which has not been used, is this.

analyzed: ṛtu grahāṇām anuvaṣaṭkurvanti etebhyaḥ vai aindrāgnam graham grahīṣyan bhavati
translated: For the seasonal cups they do not utter the Vashat after (the invocation of each deity), since he is about to draw the cup for Indra and Agni for their sake:

analyzed: tat asya aindrāgnena eva anuvaṣaṭkṛtāḥ bhavanti
translated: thus they are uttered after (the invocation of) the cup for Indra and Agni.

analyzed: yat u eva aindrāgnam graham gṛhṇāti
translated: And, again, why he draws the cup for Indra and Agni.

original: sarvaṃ vā idam prājījanadya ṛtugrahānagrahītsa🔽idaṃ sarvam prajanayyedamevaitatsarvam prāṇodānayoḥ pratiṣṭhāpayati tadidaṃ🔽sarvam prāṇodānayoḥ pratiṣṭhitamindrāgnī hi prāṇodānāvime hi dyāvāpṛthivī
analyzed: sarvam vai idam prājījanadyaḥ ṛtu grahān agrahīt sa  idam sarvam prajanayya idam eva etat sarvam prāṇa udānayoḥ pratiṣṭhāpayati tat idam  sarvam prāṇa udānayoḥ pratiṣṭhitam indra agnī hi prāṇa udānau ime hi dyāvāpṛthivī
translated: Having drawn the seasonal cups he has generated everything here;

analyzed: prāṇa udānau anayoḥ hi idam sarvam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: having generated this All he now establishes it on the out-breathing and in-breathing. Thus this All is established on the out-breathing and in-breathing. For Indra and Agni are the out-breathing and in-breathing, since these two, heaven and earth, are the out-breathing and in-breathing, and on them this All is established.

original: yadvevaindrāgnaṃ grahaṃ gṛhṇāti /🔽sarvaṃ vā idam prājījanadya ṛtugrahānagrahītsa
analyzed: yat u eva aindrāgnam graham gṛhṇāti  sarvam vai idam prājījanadyaḥ ṛtu grahān agrahīt sa
translated: And, again, why he draws the cup for Indra and Agni.🔽Having drawn the seasonal cups he has generated everything here;

analyzed: idam sarvam prajanayya asmin eva etat sarvasmin prāṇa ādānau dadhāti
translated: having generated this All he now bestows the out-breathing and in-breathing on this All.

analyzed: tau imau asmin sarvasmin prāṇa udānau hitau
translated: These two, Prāṇa and Udāna, are beneficial in this whole (universe).

original: athāto gṛhṇātyeva /🔽indrāgnī āgataṃ sutaṃ gīrbhirnabho vareṇyam / asya pātaṃ
analyzed: atha atas gṛhṇāti eva  indra agnī āgatam sutam gīrbhiḥ nabhaḥ vareṇyam asya pātam
translated: Now then he takes (the cup) indeed.🔽O Indra and Agni, come to the pressed (Soma), to the desirable oblation with songs. Drink of this

original: dhiyeṣitā / upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāgni yāṃ tvaiṣa te yonirindrāgnibhyāṃ tveti
analyzed: dhiyā iṣitaḥ upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indra agni yām tvā eṣa te yoniḥ indra agnibhyām tvā iti
translated: (Soma) which is offered by the thought (of the sacrificer). Thou art taken with a support; to Indra and Agni thee! This is thy womb; to Indra and Agni thee!

analyzed: sādayati indra agnibhyām hi enam gṛhṇāti
translated: He deposits (the cup) with 'To Indra and Agni,' for he takes it for Indra and Agni.

analyzed: atha vaiśvadevam graham gṛhṇāti
translated: Now he takes the Vaisvadeva cup.

analyzed: sarvam vai idam prājījanadyaḥ ṛtu grahān agrahīt sa
translated: Having taken the seasonal cups, he has generated all this (universe).

analyzed: yat ha etāvat eva abhaviṣyat yāvatyāḥ ha eva agre prajāḥ sṛṣṭāḥ tāvatyaḥ ha eva abhaviṣyan na
translated: If it had been just so much, as many beings were created in the beginning, so many would have been (now).

analyzed: prājaniṣyanta
translated: They would not have multiplied.

original: atha yadvaiśvadevaṃ grahaṃ gṛhṇāti /🔽idamevaitatsarvamimāḥ prajā yathāyathaṃ
analyzed: atha yat vaiśvadevam graham gṛhṇāti  idam eva etat sarvam imāḥ prajāḥ yathāyatham
translated: Now when he takes the Vaisvadeva cup,

original: vyavasṛjati tasmādimāḥ prajāḥ punarabhyāvartam prajāyante śukrapātreṇa gṛhṇātyeṣa
analyzed: vyavasṛjati tasmāt imāḥ prajāḥ punar abhyāvartam prajāyante śukra pātreṇa gṛhṇāti eṣa
translated: he thus distributes all this (universe) and these beings in the proper order. Therefore these beings are born again and again. He takes it with the Sukra cup.

original: vai śukro ya eṣa tapati tasya ye raśmayaste viśve devāstasmācukrapātreṇa gṛhṇāti / / /
analyzed: vai śukraḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati tasya ye raśmayaḥ te viśve devāḥ tasmāt cukra pātreṇa gṛhṇāti
translated: This Sukra is he who shines yonder; his rays are the All-gods. Therefore he takes it with the Sukra cup.

analyzed: atha atas gṛhṇāti eva
translated: Now then he takes (the cup) indeed.

original: omāsaścarṣaṇīrdhato viśve devāsa āgata dāśvāṃso dāśuṣaḥ sutam
analyzed: omāsaḥ carṣaṇīḥ dhataḥ viśve devāsaḥ āgata dāśvāṃsaḥ dāśuṣaḥ sutam
translated: The All-gods, O ye who distribute to men, have come to the Soma-draught of the worshipper.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si viśvebhyastvā devebhya eṣa te yonirviśvebhyastvā devebhya iti
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ eṣa te yoniḥ viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ iti
translated: Thou art taken with a support: thee to the All-gods! This is thy womb: thee to the All-gods!

original: sādayati viśvebhyo hyenaṃ devebhyo gṛhṇāti / / /🔽gṛṇāti ha vā etaddhotā yacaṃsati /
analyzed: sādayati viśvebhyaḥ hi enam devebhyaḥ gṛhṇāti  gṛṇāti ha vai etat hotā yacaṃsati
translated: He deposits it (on the mound), for he takes it for the All-gods.🔽 The Hotri, forsooth, sings to him (Agni), when he recites the Sâman;

analyzed: tasmai etat gṛṇate prati eva adhvaryuḥ āgṛṇāti
translated: and the Adhvaryu responds to him, as it were, by the Pratihâra.

analyzed: tasmāt pratigaraḥ nāma
translated: This is why it is called Pratihâra.

analyzed: tam vai prāñcam āsīnam āhvayate
translated: He (the Hotri) calls him (Agni) while sitting with his face towards the east;

original: sarve vā anya udgātuḥ prāñca ārtvijyaṃ kurvanti
analyzed: sarve vai anye udgātuḥ prāñcaḥ ārtvijyam kurvanti
translated: for all the other priests perform their priestly duties while sitting with their faces towards the east.

analyzed: tathā u ha asya etat prāk eva ārtvijyam kṛtam bhavati
translated: And thus that priestly duty of his is performed while sitting with the face towards the east.

original: prajāpatirvā udgātāḥ /🔽yoṣargghotā sa etatprajāpatirudgātā yoṣāyāmṛci hotari retaḥ
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai udgātā  yoṣā ṛc hotā saḥ etat prajāpatiḥ udgātā yoṣāyām ṛci hotari retaḥ
translated: The Udgâtri (chanter) is Pragâpati;🔽and the Hotri (reciter) is a woman: that Udgâtri, Pragâpati, pours that seed into the Hotri, the woman, in the Rik (verse).

original: siñcati yatstute taddhotā śastreṇa prajanayati tacyati yathāyam puruṣaḥ
analyzed: siñcati yat stute tat hotā śastreṇa prajanayati tacyati yathā ayam puruṣaḥ
translated: The Hotri generates it by the Sastra (litany), and it is born; just as this man (is born).

analyzed: śitaḥ tat yat enacyati tasmāt acastram nāma
translated: And because it is born (chyati) therefrom, therefore (the Sastra is called) Sastra.

analyzed: tat upapalyayya pratigṛṇāti
translated: He (the Udgâtri) responds to it (the Sastra) after it has been uttered.

analyzed: idam eva etat retaḥ siktam upanimadati atha yat parāṅ
translated: That (Sastra) is the seed which has been poured out, and which he now presses together; and what is pressed out of it is the Pratihâra (response).

original: tiṣṭhanpratigṛṇīyātparāgu haivaitadretaḥ siktam praṇaśyettanna prajāyeta samyañcā u
analyzed: tiṣṭhan pratigṛṇīyāt parāgu ha eva etat retaḥ siktam praṇaśyet tat na prajāyeta samyañcaḥ u
translated: Standing, he should respond; for that seed, thus cast, would be lost in the distance, and would not be generated.

analyzed: ca eva etat bhūtvā etat retaḥ siktam prajanayataḥ
translated: Having become united, they generate that seed, thus cast.

original: rūpāṇi jānānā abhyavāyanti te rātamanaso 'laṃ dānāya bhavanti / / /
analyzed: rūpāṇi jānānāḥ abhyavāyanti te rāta manasaḥ lam dānāya bhavanti
translated: 'They are ready for the gift',--in the same way he now approaches them with his own forms from the middle of the sacrifice; knowing their own forms they approach him, being pleased, ready for the gift.

original: tatho vo viśvavedā vibhajatviti /🔽brahma vai tuthastadenā brahmaṇā vibhajati brahma
analyzed: tathā u vaḥ viśva vedāḥ vibhajatu iti  brahma vai tuthaḥ tat enā brahmaṇā vibhajati brahma
translated: 'So may the all-knowing one divide you!'

original: vai dakṣiṇīyaṃ cādakṣiṇiyaṃ ca veda tatho hāsyaitā dakṣiṇīyāyaiva dattā bhavanti
analyzed: vai dakṣiṇīyam ca a dakṣiṇiyam ca veda tathā u ha asya etāḥ dakṣiṇīyāya eva dattāḥ bhavanti
translated: Tutha is the Brahman (priesthood): with that Brahman he divides them. The Brahman knows who is worthy of the sacrificial gift and who is not; thus those (sacrificial gifts) of his are given to one who is worthy of the sacrificial gift,

analyzed: na a dakṣiṇīyāya
translated: and not to one who is not worthy of it.

analyzed: ṛtasya pathā preta iti
translated: 'Go ye by the path of truth!'

original: yo vai devānām pathaiti sa ṛtasya pathaiti candradakṣiṇā iti
analyzed: yaḥ vai devānām pathā eti saḥ ṛtasya pathā eti candra dakṣiṇāḥ iti
translated: He who goes by the paths of the gods goes by the path of truth. 'With the sacrificial gift directed to the moon,'--

analyzed: tat etena jyotiṣā yanti
translated: with that light they go.

original: atha sado 'bhyaiti /🔽vi svaḥ paśya vyantarikṣamiti vi tvayā dakṣiṇayā lokaṃ
analyzed: atha sadaḥ bhyaiti  vi svar paśya vi antarikṣam iti vi tvayā dakṣiṇayā lokam
translated: He then goes to the Sadas.

analyzed: khyeṣam iti eva etat āha
translated: 'Open the heaven, open the air!'--'May I go to the world by thee, the sacrificial fee,' this is what he thereby says.

analyzed: atha sadaḥ prekṣate
translated: He then looks at the Sadas.

original: yatasva sadasyairiti mā tvā sadasyā atirikṣatetyevaitadāha / / /
analyzed: yatasva sadasyaiḥ iti mā tvā sadasyāḥ atirikṣata iti eva etat āha
translated: 'Be thou diligent with the Sadasya priests!'--'May the Sadasya priests not injure thee,' this is what he thereby says.

analyzed: atha hiraṇyam ādāya āgnīdhram abhyaiti
translated: He then takes the gold and goes to the Âgnîdhra.

analyzed: brāhmaṇam adya videyam pitṛmantam
translated: 'May I to-day find a Brahman who is fatherly,

original: paitṛmatyamiti yo vai jñāto jñātakulīnaḥ sa pitṛmānpaitṛmatyo yā vai jñātāyāpi
analyzed: paitṛmatyam iti yaḥ vai jñātaḥ jñāta kulīnaḥ sa pitṛmān paitṛmatyaḥ yāḥ vai jñātāya api
translated: The 'father's share' (is given to him) who is known, who is of known family; he is the father, the 'father's share.' The 'father's share' (is given to him) who, though known, gives a few sacrificial presents to the known.

original: katipayīrdakṣiṇā dadāti tābhirmahajjayatyṛṣimārṣeyamiti yo vai jñāto 'nūcānaḥ sa
analyzed: katipayīḥ dakṣiṇāḥ dadāti tābhiḥ mahat jayati ṛṣi mārṣeyam iti yaḥ vai jñātaḥ nūcānaḥ sa
translated: With them he conquers great (wealth). The 'sage's son' (is given to him) who is known, who is a student.

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ ārṣeyaḥ sudhātu dakṣiṇām iti sa hi sudhātu dakṣiṇaḥ
translated: He is the sage, the 'sage's son.' The 'good giver of sacrificial presents' (is given to him) for he is the good giver of sacrificial presents.

analyzed: atha evam upasadya
translated: Then, having approached (the priests) in this way,

original: agnīdhe hiraṇyaṃ dadātyasmadrātā devatrā gacateti yāṃ vai🔽rātamanā avicikitsandakṣiṇāṃ dadāti tayā mahajjayati devatrā gacateti devaloke me
analyzed: agnīdhe hiraṇyam dadāti asmad rātāḥ devatrā gacata iti yām vai  rāta manāḥ a vicikitsan dakṣiṇām dadāti tayā mahat jayati devatrā gacata iti deva loke me
translated: he gives gold to the Agnidhra, with (the formula), 'Given by us, go to the gods.' The sacrificial present which he gives without hesitation,

original: 'pyasaditi vai yajate yo yajate taddevaloka evainametadapitvinaṃ karoti
analyzed: pyasat iti vai yajate yaḥ yajate tat deva loke eva enam etat apitvinam karoti
translated: with that he conquers great (wealth). 'Go to the gods' (he says), thinking, 'May I be in the world of the gods.' He who sacrifices, sacrifices thinking, 'May I be in the world of the gods.' He makes him a sharer in that world of the gods.

original: pradātāramāviśateti māmāviśatetyevaitadāha tatho hāsmādetāḥ parācyo na praṇaśyanti
analyzed: pradātāram āviśata iti mām āviśata iti eva etat āha tathā u ha asmāt etāḥ parācyaḥ na praṇaśyanti
translated: 'Enter the giver' (he says), thinking, 'Enter me.' Thus indeed these (sacrificial presents) do not perish from him.

original: tadyadagnīdhe prathamāya dakṣiṇāṃ dadātyato hi viśve devā
analyzed: tat yat agnīdhe prathamāya dakṣiṇām dadāti atas hi viśve devā
translated: The reason why he gives the sacrificial present first to the Agnidhra is that from here the All-gods

analyzed: amṛta tvam apājayan tasmāt agnīdhe prathamāya dakṣiṇām dadāti
translated: obtained immortality. Therefore he gives the sacrificial present first to the Agnidhra.

analyzed: atha evam eva upasadya
translated: Then, having approached (the priests) in this way,

original: ātreyāya hiraṇyaṃ dadāti yatra vā adaḥ🔽prātaranuvākamanvāhustaddha smaitatpurā śaṃsantyatrirvā ṛṣīṇāṃ hotāsāthaitatsado
analyzed: ātreyāya hiraṇyam dadāti yatra vai adaḥ  prātaranuvākam anvāhuḥ tat ha sma etat purā śaṃsanti atriḥ vai ṛṣīṇām hotā āsa atha etat sadaḥ
translated: To Atri he gives gold. Where, indeed,🔽they recite the morning litany, there, indeed, they say this of old: Atri was the Hotri of the Rishis. Then that darkness

original: 'suratamasamabhipupruve ta ṛṣayo trimabruvannehi pratyaṅṅidaṃ tamo 'pajahīti sa
analyzed: suratamasam abhipupruve te ṛṣayaḥ trim abruvan ehi pratyaṅ idam tamaḥ pajahi iti sa
translated: approached his seat. The Rishis said to Atri: 'Come, drive away that darkness towards the west.'

original: etattamo 'pāhannayaṃ vai jyotirya idaṃ tamo 'pābadhīditi tasmā etajjyotirhiraṇyaṃ🔽dakṣiṇāmanayajjyotirhi hiraṇyaṃ tadvai sa tattejasā vīryeṇarṣistamo
analyzed: etat tamaḥ pāhan ayam vai jyotiḥ yaḥ idam tamaḥ pābadhīt iti tasmai etat jyotiḥ hiraṇyam  dakṣiṇām anayat jyotiḥ hi hiraṇyam tat vai sa tat tejasā vīryeṇa ṛṣiḥ tamaḥ
translated: He drove away that darkness. 'Verily, he is the light who has driven away that darkness,' (they said). To him they gave that light, gold,

analyzed: pajaghāna atha eṣaḥ etena eva etat jyotiṣā tamaḥ pahanti tasmāt ātreyāya hiraṇyam dadhāti
translated: as a sacrificial fee; for gold is light. By that light, by that splendour, by that power, the Rishi drove away the darkness. Now he, by that same light, drives away the darkness. Therefore he gives gold to Atri.

analyzed: atha brahmaṇe
translated: Then to the Brahman.

analyzed: brahmā hi yajñam dakṣiṇatas bhigopāyati atha udgātre tha hotre
translated: For the Brahman guards the sacrifice on the south side. Then to the Udgâtri, then to the Hotri.

analyzed: tha adhvaryubhyām havirdhāne āsīnābhyām atha punar etya prastotre tha
translated: Then to the two Adhvaryus sitting in the Havirdhâna. Then, having returned, to the Prastotri. Then

analyzed: maitrāvaruṇāya atha brāhmaṇācaṃsīne tha potre tha neṣṭre tha ācāvākāya atha unnetre tha
translated: to the Maitravaruna. Then to the Brâhmanâkhamsin. Then to the Potri. Then to the Neshṭar. Then to the Agnîdh. Then to the Unnetri.🔽Then to the Grâvastut.

original: grāvastute 'tha subrahmaṇyāyai pratihartra uttamāya dadāti pratihartā vā eṣa so 'smā
analyzed: grāvastute tha subrahmaṇyāyai pratihartre uttamāya dadāti pratihartā vai eṣa saḥ sma
translated: He then gives to the Pratiprasthâtri, for the Subrahmaṇyâ, the last (graha); for he is the Pratiprasthâtri of this (graha).

original: etadantataḥ pratiharati tatho hāsmādetāḥ parācyo na praṇaśyanti / / /
analyzed: etat antatas pratiharati tathā u ha asmāt etāḥ parācyaḥ na praṇaśyanti
translated: He (the Adhvaryu) takes it from him at the end; and thus those (grahas) do not pass away from him.

analyzed: atha āha indrāya marutvate nubrūhi iti
translated: He then says, 'Recite (the invitatory prayer) to Indra with the Maruts!'

original: yatra vai prajāpatiragre dadau taddhendra🔽īkṣāṃ cakre sarvaṃ vā ayamidaṃ dāsyati nāsmabhyaṃ kiṃ cana pariśekṣyatīti sa etaṃ
analyzed: yatra vai prajāpatiḥ agre dadau tat ha indra  īkṣām cakre sarvam vai ayam idam dāsyati na asmabhyam kim cana pariśekṣyati iti saḥ etam
translated: Now when Pragâpati first gave (the grahas), Indra

analyzed: vajram udayacat indrāya marutvate nubrūhi iti adānāya tatas na adadāt saḥ eṣa u pi etarhi
translated: looked on (enviously), thinking, 'Surely, he will give everything to him, and will leave nothing for us!' He then hurled that thunderbolt at him, saying, 'Recite to Indra with the Maruts!' in order to prevent his giving (the grahas). He then gave (the grahas) to him. And now,

original: tathaiva vajra udyamyata indrāya marutvate 'nubrūhītyadānāya tato na dadāti / / /
analyzed: tathā eva vajraḥ udyamyate indrāya marutvate nubrūhi iti adānāya tatas na dadāti
translated: in like manner, that thunderbolt is hurled at him, saying, 'Recite to Indra with the Maruts!' in order to prevent his giving (the grahas). He then gives (the grahas) to him.

original: catasro vai dakṣiṇāḥ /🔽hiraṇyamāyurevaitenātmanastrāyata āyurhi hiraṇyaṃ tadagnaya🔽āgnīdhraṃ kurvate 'dadāttasmādapyetarhyagnīdhe hiraṇyaṃ dīyate / / /
analyzed: catasraḥ vai dakṣiṇāḥ  hiraṇyam āyuḥ eva etena ātmanaḥ trāyate āyuḥ hi hiraṇyam tat agnaye  āgnīdhram kurvate dadāt tasmāt api etarhi agnīdhe hiraṇyam dīyate
translated: There are four sacrificial presents,🔽the gold (coin) for Agni; for by that (graha) he (Pragâpati) saved his own life, for gold is life; he made the Âgnîdhra (priest) to be the Âgnîdhra (bearer of the oblations to Agni); he gave (the gold coin) to him: hence at the present day gold is given to the Âgnîdhra.

original: atha gauḥ / prāṇamevaitayātmanastrāyate prāṇo hi gaurannaṃ hi gaurannaṃ hi
analyzed: atha gauḥ prāṇam eva etayā ātmanaḥ trāyate prāṇaḥ hi gauḥ annam hi gauḥ annam hi
translated: Then the cow; by that (graha) he saves his own breath, for the cow is breath, for the cow is food, and breath is food.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ tām rudrāya hotre dadāt
translated: Prana gave it to Rudra, the Hotri priest.

original: atha vāsaḥ / tvacamevaitenātmanastrāyate tvagghi vāsastadbṛhaspataya udgāyate
analyzed: atha vāsaḥ tvacam eva etena ātmanaḥ trāyate tvac hi vāsaḥ tat bṛhaspataye udgāyate
translated: Then the garment. By this he protects the skin of his own body, for the garment is indeed the skin. That Brihaspati sang.

original: 'dadāt / / /🔽athāśvaḥ / vajro vā aśvo vajramevaitatpurogāṃ kurute yamaloke me 'pyasaditi vai
analyzed: dadāt  atha aśvaḥ vajraḥ vai aśvaḥ vajram eva etat purogām kurute yama loke me pi asat iti vai
translated: He gave it to him.

original: yajate yo yajate tadyamaloka evainametadapitvinaṃ karoti taṃ yamāya brahmaṇe
analyzed: yajate yaḥ yajate tat yama loke eva enam etat apitvinam karoti tam yamāya brahmaṇe
translated: Then the horse. The horse is indeed a thunderbolt. He makes the thunderbolt his forerunner. He sacrifices thinking, May I have a share in the world of Yama. He who sacrifices sacrifices thinking, May I have a share in the world of Yama. He makes him a partaker in the world of Yama. He gave it to Yama, the Brahman priest.

analyzed: dadāt
translated: He gave it to him.

original: sa hiraṇyam pratyeti /🔽agnaye tvā mahyaṃ varuṇo dadātvityagnaye hyetadvaruṇo
analyzed: sa hiraṇyam pratyeti  agnaye tvā mahyam varuṇaḥ dadātu iti agnaye hi etat varuṇaḥ
translated: He accepts the gold.

analyzed: dadhāt saḥ mṛta tvam aśīya āyuḥ dātre edhi mayaḥ mahyam pratigrahītre iti
translated: To Agni for me Varuna gives it, for Varuna indeed gave this to Agni. May he attain immortality. Be life to the giver. Be vigor to me the receiver. He accepts it.

original: atha gām pratyeti /🔽rudrāya tvā mahyaṃ varuṇo dadātviti rudrāya hyetāṃ varuṇo
analyzed: atha gām pratyeti  rudrāya tvā mahyam varuṇaḥ dadātu iti rudrāya hi etām varuṇaḥ
translated: Then he accepts the cow.

original: 'dadātso 'mṛtatvamaśīya prāṇo dātra edhi vayo mahyam pratigrahītra iti / / /
analyzed: dadāt saḥ mṛta tvam aśīya prāṇaḥ dātre edhi vayaḥ mahyam pratigrahītre iti
translated: To Rudra for me Varuna gives it, for Varuna indeed gave this to Rudra. May he attain immortality. Be breath to the giver. Be vigor to me the receiver. He accepts it.

analyzed: atha vāsaḥ pratyeti
translated: Then he accepts the garment.

original: bṛhaspataye tvā mahyaṃ varuṇo dadātviti bṛhaspataye
analyzed: bṛhaspataye tvā mahyam varuṇaḥ dadātu iti bṛhaspataye
translated: To Brihaspati for me Varuna gives it, for Brihaspati indeed gave this to Varuna. May he attain immortality. Be vigor to the giver. Be vigor to me the receiver. He accepts it.

original: hyetadvaruṇo 'dadātso 'mṛtatvamaśīya tvagdātra edhi mayo mahyam pratigrahītra iti / / /
analyzed: hi etat varuṇaḥ dadāt saḥ mṛta tvam aśīya tvac dātre edhi mayaḥ mahyam pratigrahītre iti
translated: For Varuna gave this (horse) to him. 'May I attain immortality. Be thou the skin to the giver, the flesh to me, the receiver', (with these words) he touches it.

original: athāśvam pratyeti /🔽yamāya tvā mahyaṃ varuṇo dadātviti yamāya hyetaṃ varuṇo
analyzed: atha aśvam pratyeti  yamāya tvā mahyam varuṇaḥ dadātu iti yamāya hi etam varuṇaḥ
translated: Then he approaches the horse,

original: 'dadātso 'mṛtatvamaśīya hayo dātra edhi vayo mahyam pratigrahītra iti / / /
analyzed: dadāt saḥ mṛta tvam aśīya hayaḥ dātre edhi vayaḥ mahyam pratigrahītre iti
translated: 'To Yama thee, may Varuna give to me', (with this formula) he approaches it; for to Yama Varuna gave this (horse). 'May I attain immortality. Be thou the skin to the giver, the flesh to me, the receiver', (with these words) he touches it.

original: atha yadanyaddadāti /🔽kāmenaiva taddadātīdam me 'pyamutrāsāditi tatpratyeti ko
analyzed: atha yat anyat dadāti  kāmena eva tat dadāti idam me pi amutra āsāt iti tat pratyeti kaḥ
translated: Then what other (animal) he gives,

original: 'dātkasmā adātkāmo 'dātkāmāyādāt kāmo dātā kāmaḥ pratigrahītā kāmaitatta iti
analyzed: dāt kasmai adāt kāmaḥ dāt kāmāya adāt kāmaḥ dātā kāmaḥ pratigrahītā kāma etat te iti
translated: he gives it out of desire, thinking, 'May this also be for me hereafter.' He approaches it, (saying), 'Who gave? To whom did he give? Out of desire he gave, to desire he gave. Desire is the giver, desire is the receiver. This is thine, O desire',

analyzed: tat devatāyai atidiśati
translated: he thereby assigns it to the deity.

original: tadāhuḥ / na devatāyā atidiśedidaṃ vai yāṃ devatāṃ saminddhe sā dīpyamānā🔽śvaḥśvaḥ śreyasī bhavatīdaṃ vai yasminnagnāvabhyādadhati sa dīpyamāna eva
analyzed: tat āhuḥ na devatāyai atidiśet idam vai yām devatām saminddhe sā dīpyamānā  śvas śvas śreyasī bhavati idam vai yasmin agnau abhyādadhati sa dīpyamānaḥ eva
translated: As to that they say, 'Let him not assign it to the deity; for that deity which he kindles here, being kindled,🔽becomes better and better day by day. That fire into which they put fuel becomes ever more and more kindled,

original: śvaḥśvaḥ śreyānbhavati śvaḥśvo ha vai śreyānbhavati ya evaṃ vidvānpratigṛhṇāti
analyzed: śvas śvas śreyān bhavati śvas śvas ha vai śreyān bhavati yaḥ evam vidvān pratigṛhṇāti
translated: and day by day becomes better and better. Day by day he becomes better and better who, knowing thus, accepts (a gift).

original: tadyathā samiddhe juhuyādevametāṃ juhoti yāmadhīyate dadāti
analyzed: tat yathā samiddhe juhuyāt evam etām juhoti yām adhīyate dadāti
translated: As one would offer into a blazing fire, so he offers into this one, which is called 'Adhrigu'.

analyzed: tasmāt adhīyan na atidiśet
translated: Therefore, one should not direct one's speech while reciting the Adhrigu.

analyzed: trayāḥ vai devāḥ
translated: There are three classes of gods:

original: vasavo rudrā ādityāsteṣāṃ vibhaktāni savanāni vasūnāmeva
analyzed: vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ teṣām vibhaktāni savanāni vasūnām eva
translated: the Vasus, the Rudras, and the Adityas. Their libations are divided. The morning libation is for the Vasus,

original: prātaḥsavanaṃ rudrāṇām mādhyandinaṃ savanamādityānāṃ tṛtīyasavanaṃ tadvā
analyzed: prātaḥsavanam rudrāṇām mādhyandinam savanam ādityānām tṛtīyasavanam tat vā
translated: the midday libation for the Rudras, and the third libation for the Adityas. That is

original: amiśrameva vasūnām prātaḥsavanamamiśraṃ rudrāṇām mādhyandinaṃ savanam
analyzed: amiśram eva vasūnām prātaḥsavanam amiśram rudrāṇām mādhyandinam savanam
translated: the unmixed morning libation for the Vasus, the unmixed midday libation for the Rudras,

analyzed: miśram ādityānām tṛtīyasavanam
translated: and the mixed third libation for the Adityas.

analyzed: te ha ādityāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Adityas said:

analyzed: yathā idam amiśram vasūnām prātaḥsavanam amiśram rudrāṇām
translated: Just as this is the unmixed morning libation for the Vasus, the unmixed midday libation for the Rudras,

original: mādhyandinaṃ savanamevaṃ na imam purā miśrādgrahaṃ juhutheti tatheti devā
analyzed: mādhyandinam savanam evam naḥ imam purā miśrāt graham juhutha iti tathā iti devā
translated: so do not offer this libation before the mixed one. The gods said, So be it.

original: abruvaṃste saṃsthita eva mādhyandine savane purā tṛtīyasavanādetamajuhavuḥ sa🔽eṣo 'pyetarhi tathaiva graho hūyate saṃsthita eva mādhyandine savane purā
analyzed: abruvan te saṃsthite eva mādhyandine savane purā tṛtīyasavanāt etam ajuhavuḥ sa  eṣa u pi etarhi tathā eva grahaḥ hūyate saṃsthitaḥ eva mādhyandine savane purā
translated: They offered this libation before the third libation, at the conclusion of the midday pressing.

analyzed: tṛtīyasavanāt
translated: Even now this libation is offered in the same way, at the conclusion of the midday pressing, before the third libation.

analyzed: te ha ādityāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Adityas said:

original: neva vā itarasmintsavane smo nevetarasminyadvai no rakṣāṃsi na🔽hiṃsyuriti / / /
analyzed: na iva vai itarasmin savane smaḥ na iva itarasmin yat vai naḥ rakṣāṃsi na  hiṃsyuḥ iti
translated: lest they should be in one place and we in another, or lest the Rakshas should injure us.

analyzed: te ha dvi devatyān ūcuḥ
translated: They said to the two-deity offerings:

analyzed: rakṣobhyaḥ vai bibhīmaḥ hanta yuṣmān praviśāma iti
translated: 'We fear the Rakshas; let us enter you.'

analyzed: te ha dvidevatyāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The two-deity offerings said:

analyzed: kim asmākam tatas syāt iti asmābhiḥ anuvaṣaṭkṛtā
translated: 'What will be ours from that?'

analyzed: bhaviṣyatha iti u ha ādityāḥ ūcuḥ tathā iti te dvidevatyān prāviśan
translated: 'You will be with us at the Vashat-calling,' said the Adityas. 'So be it,' they said, and entered the two-deity offerings.

analyzed: sa yatra prātaḥsasavane
translated: When at the morning pressing

analyzed: dvi devatyaiḥ pracarati tat pratiprasthātā āditya pātreṇa
translated: he performs with the two-deity offerings, then the Pratiprasthātṛ takes up with the Aditya vessel

analyzed: droṇakalaśāt pratinigṛhṇīte upayāma gṛhītaḥ
translated: from the Dronakalasha with 'You are taken up with a support', with this much.

analyzed: si iti etāvatā adhvaryuḥ eva āśrāvayati adhvaryoḥ anu homam juhoti
translated: The Adhvaryu alone calls for the proclamation; after the Adhvaryu's proclamation he offers the oblation.

analyzed: pratiprasthātā ādityebhyaḥ tvā iti saṃsravam avanayati etāvatā evam eva sarveṣu
translated: The Pratiprasthātṛ pours down the remnants with 'To the Adityas to you!' with this much. In the same way in all (offerings).

analyzed: tat yat pratiprasthātā pratinigṛhṇīte  dvi devatyān vai prāviśan asmābhiḥ anuvaṣaṭkṛtā
translated: The reason why the Pratiprasthātṛ takes up (the Soma) is this.🔽They entered the two-deity offerings, saying: 'You will be with us at the Vashat-calling.'

original: bhaviṣyathetyu hādityā ūcuryāṃ vā amūṃ dvitīyāmāhutiṃ juhoti sviṣṭakṛte vai tāṃ
analyzed: bhaviṣyatha iti u ha ādityāḥ ūcuḥ yām vai amūm dvitīyām āhutim juhoti sviṣṭakṛte vai tām
translated: The Adityas said: 'The second oblation which you offer is for the Svishtakrit.'

original: juhoti sviṣṭakṛto vā ete 'nuvaṣaṭkriyante tatho hāsyaite 'nuvaṣaṭkṛtā iṣṭasviṣṭakṛto
analyzed: juhoti sviṣṭakṛtaḥ vai ete nuvaṣaṭkriyante tathā u ha asya ete nuvaṣaṭkṛtāḥ iṣṭa sviṣṭakṛtaḥ
translated: He offers, because these (oblations) are pronounced 'Vasat!' after the Svishtakrit; thus these (oblations) pronounced 'Vasat!' after the Svishtakrit are offered to the Svishtakrit.

original: bhavantyuttarārdhe juhotyeṣā hyetasya devasya diktasmāduttarārdhe juhoti / / /
analyzed: bhavanti uttara ardhe juhoti eṣā hi etasya devasya diś tasmāt uttara ardhe juhoti
translated: He offers on the north part, for that is the quarter of that god; therefore he offers on the north part.

analyzed: yat u eva pratiprasthātā pratinigṛhṇīte
translated: And again why the Pratiprasthâtri takes possession of (the Soma).

analyzed: dvi devatyān vai prāviśan sa yān eva
translated: The two-deity (oblations) indeed entered (the sacrifice); those which

original: prāviśaṃstebhya evaitannirmimīte 'thāpidadhāti rakṣobhyo hyabibhayurviṣṇa🔽urugāyaiṣa te somastaṃ rakṣasva mā tvā dabhanniti yajño vai
analyzed: prāviśan tebhyaḥ eva etat nirmimīte tha apidadhāti rakṣobhyaḥ hi abibhayuḥ viṣṇo  urugāya eṣa te somaḥ tam rakṣasva mā tvā dabhan iti yajñaḥ vai
translated: have entered, from them he now fashions (the oblations); he then covers (the Soma); for they were afraid of the Rakshas.

original: viṣṇustadyajñāyaivaitatparidadāti guptyā athāha saṃsthita eva mādhyandine savane
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ tat yajñāya eva etat paridadāti guptyai atha āha saṃsthite eva mādhyandine savane
translated: 'This is thy Soma, O Vishnu, the wide-goer! Guard it! Let it not escape thee!' Vishnu is the sacrifice; to the sacrifice itself he thus commits it for protection. He then says, 'The midday-pressing is completed;

analyzed: purā tṛtīyasavanāt ehi yajamāna iti
translated: come to the sacrifice, O sacrificer, before the third pressing!'

analyzed: samprapadyante  adhvaryuḥ ca yajamānaḥ ca āgnīdhraḥ ca pratiprasthātā ca unnetā atha yaḥ
translated: They go together.

analyzed: nyaḥ paricaraḥ bhavati ubhe dvāre apidadhati rakṣobhyaḥ
translated: The Adhvaryu, the sacrificer, the Âgnîdhra, the Pratiprasthâtri, and the Unnetri; and whoever else there is of the attendants, they shut up both doors against the Rakshas.

original: hyabibhayurathādhvaryurādityasthālīṃ cādityapātraṃ cādatte sa uparyupari pūtabhṛtaṃ
analyzed: hi abibhayuḥ atha adhvaryuḥ āditya sthālīm ca āditya pātram ca ādatte saḥ upari upari pūtabhṛtam
translated: The Adhvaryu then, fearless, takes the Âditya-pot and the Âditya-vessel, and holds them above the Pûtabhrit (the purified vessel).

original: vigṛhṇāti nedvyavaścotaditi / / /🔽atha gṛhṇāti /🔽kadā cana starīrasi nendra saścāsi dāśuṣe upopennu maghavanbhūya
analyzed: vigṛhṇāti na id vyavaścotat iti  atha gṛhṇāti  kadā cana starīrasi na indra saścā asi dāśuṣe upa upa id nu maghavan bhūya
translated: He holds them above it lest it should be spilt.

original: innu te dānaṃ devasya pṛcyata ādityebhyastveti / / /
analyzed: id nu te dānam devasya pṛcyate ādityebhyaḥ tvā iti
translated: He then draws (the Soma) with , 'Thou art taken with a support: thou art the immortal, the unaging, the ever-young food of the gods. Thee to the Âdityas!'

original: taṃ vai nopayāmena gṛhṇīyāt /🔽agre hyevaiṣa upayāmena gṛhīto bhavatyajāmitāyai
analyzed: tam vai na upayāmena gṛhṇīyāt  agre hi eva eṣa upayāmena gṛhītaḥ bhavati ajāmitāyai
translated: He should not draw it with the 'Upayâma' (call),🔽for it has already been drawn with the 'Upayâma' (call) before, for the sake of non-kinship.

analyzed: jāmi ha kuryāt yat enam atra api upayāmena gṛhṇīyāt
translated: He would commit a breach of kinship if he were to draw it here also with the 'Upayâma' (call).

original: athāpagṛhya punarānayati /🔽kadā cana prayucasyubhe nipāsi janmanī turīyāditya
analyzed: atha apagṛhya punar ānayati  kadā cana prayucasi ubhe nipāsi janmanī turīya āditya
translated: He then takes it off (the fire) and brings it back again.🔽'Never art thou cast away: thou art not broken for the worshipper, O Indra. Come hither, O bountiful one, to the worshipper's house.

analyzed: savanam te indriyam ātasthau amṛtam divi ādityebhyaḥ tvā iti
translated: Here, O god, thy gift is prepared for thee. Thee to the Âdityas!'🔽He should not draw it with the 'Upayâma' (call),🔽for it has already been drawn with the 'Upayâma' (call) before, for the sake of non-kinship.🔽He would commit a breach of kinship if he were to draw it here also with the 'Upayâma' (call).

original: atha dadhi gṛhṇāti /🔽ādityānāṃ vai tṛtīyasavanamādityānvā anu
analyzed: atha dadhi gṛhṇāti  ādityānām vai tṛtīyasavanam ādityān vai anu
translated: He then takes the sour milk.

original: paśavastatpaśuṣvevaitatpayo dadhāti tadidam paśuṣu payo hitam madhyata iva
analyzed: paśavaḥ tat paśuṣu eva etat payaḥ dadhāti tat idam paśuṣu payaḥ hitam madhyatas iva
translated: The third pressing belongs to the Âdityas, and cattle are after the Âdityas: he thus puts milk into cattle, and that milk is infused into cattle from the middle (of the body).

original: gṛhṇīyādityāhurmadhyata iva hīdam paśūnām paya iti paścādiva tveva
analyzed: gṛhṇīyāt iti āhuḥ madhyataḥ iva hi idam paśūnām payaḥ iti paścāt iva tu eva
translated: They say he should take it from the middle, for this is as it were the milk of cattle. But rather from the back.

analyzed: gṛhṇīyāt paścāt iva hi idam paśūnām payaḥ
translated: Let him take it from the middle, they say, for this milk of animals is as it were from the middle. But let him rather take it from the back, for this milk of animals is as it were from the back.

analyzed: yat u eva dadhi gṛhṇāti
translated: And, again, as to why he takes sour milk.

original: hutociṣṭā vā ete saṃsravā bhavanti nālamāhutyai
analyzed: huta uciṣṭāḥ vai ete saṃsravāḥ bhavanti na alam āhutyai
translated: These remnants have been left over from the oblations, and are not sufficient for an oblation.

original: tānevaitatpunarāpyāyayati tathālamāhutyai bhavanti tasmāddadhi gṛhṇāti / / /🔽sa gṛhṇāti / yajño devānām pratyeti sumnamādityāso bhavatā mṛḍayantaḥ ā vo 'rvācī
analyzed: tān eva etat punar āpyāyayati tathā alam āhutyai bhavanti tasmāt dadhi gṛhṇāti  sa gṛhṇāti yajñaḥ devānām pratyeti sumnam ādityāsaḥ bhavata mṛḍayantaḥ ā vaḥ rvācī
translated: He thus makes them swell again, and they become sufficient for an oblation: this is why he takes sour milk.

analyzed: sumatiḥ vavṛtya a daṃhoḥ cidyā varivaḥ vittarā asat ādityebhyaḥ tvā iti
translated: He takes it with the text , 'The sacrifice of the gods returns to the favour of the gods, O Âdityas, be ye propitious, and may your most gracious favour turn unto us!' and, 'To the Âdityas be it!'

original: tamupāṃśusavanena mekṣayati /🔽vivasvānvā eṣa ādityo nidānena yadupāṃśusavana
analyzed: tam upāṃśusavanena mekṣayati  vivasvān vai eṣaḥ ādityaḥ nidānena yat upāṃśusavana
translated: He then pours it into the Upâmsu-cup.🔽The Upâmsu-savana (cup) is Vivasvat by name, and this (cup) is Vivasvat by name: he thus places it in its own abode.

original: ādityagraho vā eṣa bhavati tadenaṃ sva eva bhāge prīṇāti / / /🔽taṃ na daśābhirna pavitreṇopaspṛśati ete vai śukravatī rasavatī savane
analyzed: ādityagrahaḥ vai eṣa bhavati tat enam sve eva bhāge prīṇāti  tam na daśābhiḥ na pavitreṇa upaspṛśati ete vai śukravatī rasavatī savane
translated: And, again, as to why he takes sour milk. This (Upâmsu) is an Âditya libation: he thus gratifies it in its own share.

analyzed: yat prātaḥsavanam ca mādhyandinam ca savanam atha etat nirdhīta śukram
translated: He does not touch it either with the ten (fingers) or with the strainer. For those two pressings, the morning and the midday pressing, are rich in ghee and rich in juice; but this (libation) is pressed out of the ghee.

original: yattṛtīyasavanaṃ sa yanna daśābhirna pavitreṇopaspṛśati teno
analyzed: yat tṛtīyasavanam sa yat na daśābhiḥ na pavitreṇa upaspṛśati tena u
translated: In that he does not touch it with the fringe or the strainer,

translated: then this third pressing of his becomes as sweet as curds. Therefore he does not touch it with the fringe or the strainer.

analyzed: sa mekṣayati
translated: He tastes it.

analyzed: vivasvan āditya eṣa te soma pīthaḥ tasmin matsva iti atha unnetra
translated: To Vivasvan Âditya this is thy Soma-drink; rejoice in it. Then he hands the Upâmsu-cup to the Unnetri.

original: upāṃśusavanam prayacatyathāhonnetāramāsṛja grāvṇa iti tānādhavanīye vāsṛjati
analyzed: upāṃśusavanam prayacati atha āha unnetāram āsṛja grāvṇaḥ iti tān ādhavanīye vā āsṛjati
translated: Then he says to the Unnetri, Throw the pressing-stones into the Âdhavanîya. He throws them into the Âdhavanîya,

analyzed: camase vā

analyzed: rājānam unnīya
translated: Having poured out the king (Soma),

analyzed: ādityānām vai tṛtīyasavanam ādityān vai anu grāvāṇaḥ tat enān sve eva  bhāge prīṇāti aporṇuvanti dvāre
translated: the pressing-stones are after the Âdityas, the third pressing; he thus gratifies them in their own share. They open the doors.
