original: urorantarikṣasyādhyakṣebhya iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti nānuvaṣaṭkaroti netpaśūnagnau
analyzed: uroḥ antarikṣasya adhyakṣebhyaḥ iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti na anuvaṣaṭkaroti na id paśūn agnau
translated: He offers with 'Vashat' to the overseers of the middle region of the sky. He does not utter 'Anuvashat'. Lest he should offer the cattle into the fire.

analyzed: pravṛṇajāni iti prayacati pratiprasthātre saṃsravau
translated: He offers with 'Vashat' to the overseers of the air-space of the breast. He does not utter an 'Anuvashat'. Lest he should cast the cattle into the fire. He hands over (the Soma) to the Pratiprasthātṛ. The two remnants (of the Soma in the Dhruva and in the Agrayaṇa vessel).

original: atha punaḥ prapadya /🔽āgrayaṇamādatta udīcīnadaśam pavitraṃ vitanvanti
analyzed: atha punar prapadya  āgrayaṇam ādatte udīcīna daśam pavitram vitanvanti
translated: Then, having returned (to the Sadas),🔽he takes the Āgrayana vessel. They spread out the strainer with its fringes turned to the north.

analyzed: praskandayati adhvaryuḥ āgrayaṇasya pratiprasthātā sampragṛhṇāti
translated: The Adhvaryu makes it flow (into the Havirdhāna), the Pratiprasthātṛ takes hold of it.

original: saṃsravāvānayatyunnetā camasena vodañcanena vā / / /🔽taṃ catasṛṇāṃ dhārāṇāmāgrayaṇaṃ gṛhṇāti /🔽ādityānāṃ vai tṛtīyasavanamādityānvā anu
analyzed: saṃsravau ānayati unnetā camasena vā udañcanena vā  tam catasṛṇām dhārāṇām āgrayaṇam gṛhṇāti  ādityānām vai tṛtīyasavanam ādityān vai anu
translated: The Unnetr brings the remnants in a cup or a drawing-vessel.🔽He draws the Āgrayana draught from four streams.

analyzed: gāvaḥ tasmāt idam gavām caturdhā vihitam payaḥ tasmāt catasṛṇām dhārāṇām āgrayaṇam
translated: The third pressing belongs to the Ādityas, and the cows are connected with the Ādityas. Therefore this milk of the cows is divided into four parts. Therefore he draws the Āgrayana from four streams.

analyzed: gṛhṇāti
translated: He draws it.

original: tadyatpratiprasthātā saṃsravau sampragṛhṇāti /🔽ādityagraho vā eṣa bhavati na vā
analyzed: tat yat pratiprasthātā saṃsravau sampragṛhṇāti  ādityagrahaḥ vai eṣa bhavati na vā
translated: In that the Pratiprasthātṛ takes hold of the two remnants,

analyzed: ādityagrahasya anuvaṣaṭkaroti etasmāt vai sāvitram graham grahīṣyan bhavati tat asya
translated: this is a draught for the Ādityas. He does not utter an 'Anuvasat' for the Āditya draught. For he is about to draw the Savitr draught from that (Āditya draught). Then

analyzed: sāvitreṇa eva anuvaṣaṭkṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: it is as if an 'Anuvasat' has been uttered for his Savitr draught.

original: yadveva pratiprasthātā saṃsravau sampragṛhṇāti /🔽purā vā ebhya
analyzed: yat u eva pratiprasthātā saṃsravau sampragṛhṇāti  purā vai ebhyaḥ
translated: And again, why the Pratiprasthâtri takes up the two remnants.

original: etanmiśrādgrahamahauṣuḥ purā tṛtīyasavanāttṛtīyasavanāya vā eṣa graho gṛhyate
analyzed: etat miśrāt graham ahauṣuḥ purā tṛtīyasavanāt tṛtīyasavanāya vai eṣa grahaḥ gṛhyate
translated: Before this (Soma) was mixed, they used to take the grahas from it; before the third pressing, for this graha is drawn for the third pressing.

analyzed: tat ādityāḥ tṛtīyasavanam apiyanti tathā na bahirdhā yajñāt bhavanti
translated: The gods then went to the third pressing, and thus they did not go outside the sacrifice.

analyzed: tasmāt pratiprasthātā saṃsravau sampragṛhṇāti
translated: For this reason the Pratiprasthâtri takes up the two remnants.

analyzed: manaḥ ha vai asya savitā
translated: Savitri, doubtless, is his (Pragâpati's) mind;

original: tasmātsāvitraṃ gṛhṇāti pāṇo ha vā asya savitā
analyzed: tasmāt sāvitram gṛhṇāti pāṇaḥ ha vai asya savitā
translated: and for this reason he draws the Sâvitra graha. Savitri, doubtless, is his (Pragâpati's) hand;

analyzed: tam eva asmin etat purastāt prāṇam dadhāti yat upāṃśu gṛhṇāti
translated: and in thus taking the Upâmsu he lays that vital air into him (Pragâpati) in front;

original: tamevāsminnetatpaścātprāṇaṃ dadhāti yatsāvitraṃ gṛhṇāti tāvimā ubhayataḥ prāṇau
analyzed: tam eva asmin etat paścāt prāṇam dadhāti yat sāvitram gṛhṇāti tau imau ubhayatas prāṇau
translated: and in thus taking the Sâvitra graha he lays that vital air into him from behind. These two vital airs are placed on both sides of him,

analyzed: hitau yaḥ ca ayam upariṣṭāt yaḥ ca adhastāt
translated: the one above and the other below.

original: ṛtavo vai saṃvatsaro yajñaḥ /🔽te 'daḥ prātaḥsavane pratyakṣamavakalpyante
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ vai saṃvatsaraḥ yajñaḥ  te daḥ prātaḥsavane pratyakṣam avakalpyante
translated: The year, the sacrifice, is the seasons.🔽They are directly represented at the morning feast,🔽in that he draws the seasonal grahas. Now they are indirectly represented at the midday feast,

analyzed: yat ṛtu grahān gṛhṇāti atha etat paro kṣam mādhyandine savane
translated: in that he draws the Sâvitra grahas.

original: yadṛtupātrābhyām marutvatīyāngṛhṇāti na vā atrartubhya iti kaṃ cana grahaṃ
analyzed: yat ṛtu pātrābhyām marutvatīyān gṛhṇāti na vai atra ṛtubhyaḥ iti kam cana graham
translated: In that he draws the Marutvatîya cups with the two Ritavyas, no cup is drawn here for the sake of the seasons,

analyzed: gṛhṇanti na ṛtu pātrābhyām kaścana grahaḥ gṛhyate
translated: and no cup is drawn with the two Ritavyas.

original: eṣa vai savitā ya eṣa tapati /🔽eṣa u eva sarva ṛtavastadṛtavaḥ saṃvatsarastṛtīyasavane
analyzed: eṣa vai savitā yaḥ eṣa tapati  eṣaḥ u eva sarve ṛtavaḥ tat ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ tṛtīyasavane
translated: That yonder burning (sun) is indeed Savitri,

analyzed: pratyakṣam avakalpyante tasmāt sāvitram gṛhṇāti
translated: and he is all the seasons. Thus the seasons are directly represented at the third pressing of the Savanas. Therefore he draws the Savitr cup.

analyzed: tam vai upāṃśu pātreṇa gṛhṇāti
translated: He draws it with the Upâmsu vessel.

original: mano ha vā asya savitā prāṇa🔽upāṃśustasmādupāṃśupātreṇa gṛhṇātyantaryāmapātreṇa vā samānaṃ
analyzed: manaḥ ha vai asya savitā prāṇa  upāṃśuḥ tasmāt upāṃśu pātreṇa gṛhṇāti antaryāma pātreṇa vā samānam
translated: Savitri is his mind,🔽and the Upâmsu is the breath. Therefore he draws it with the Upâmsu vessel. Or with the Antaryâma vessel,

analyzed: hi etat yat upāṃśvantaryāmau prāṇa udānau hi
translated: for the Upâmsu and Antaryâma are the same, for the Upâmsu and Antaryâma are the out- and in-breathing.

original: āgrayaṇādgṛhṇāti /🔽mano ha vā asya savitātmāgrayaṇa ātmanyevaitanmano dadhāti
analyzed: āgrayaṇāt gṛhṇāti  manaḥ ha vai asya savitā ātmā āgrayaṇaḥ ātmani eva etat manaḥ dadhāti
translated: He draws it from the Âgrayana (graha).🔽Savitri is his mind, and the Âgrayana is the self: he thus places the mind in the self.

original: prāṇo ha vā asya savitātmāgrayaṇa ātmanyevaitatprāṇaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ha vai asya savitā ātmā āgrayaṇaḥ ātmani eva etat prāṇam dadhāti
translated: Savitri is his breath, and the Âgrayana is the self: he thus places the breath in the self.

analyzed: atha atas gṛhṇāti eva
translated: He now draws (the cup) for Savitri.

analyzed: vāmam adya savitar vāmam u śvas dive dive vāmam asmabhyam
translated: 'The pleasant to-day, O Savitri, the pleasant to-morrow, the pleasant each day,

original: sāvīḥ vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrerayā dhiyā vāmabhājaḥ syāma upayāmagṛhīto
analyzed: sāvīḥ vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrerayā dhiyā vāma bhājaḥ syāma upayāma gṛhītaḥ
translated: O God, be thou the bestower of the wealth of the pious: by our devotion may we be partakers of thy bounty. Taken upon a base.

original: 'si sāvitro 'si canodhāścanodhā asi cano mayi dhehi jinva yajñaṃ jinva yajñapatim
analyzed: si sāvitraḥ si canaḥ dhāḥ canaḥ dhāḥ asi canaḥ mayi dhehi jinva yajñam jinva yajñapatim
translated: For thou art the lord of the good abode, O god; by our prayer may we be partakers of the good abode. Thou art taken with a support: thou art Savitri, the supporter of the consent. Support the consent in me. Impel the sacrifice. Impel the lord of the sacrifice.

analyzed: bhagāya iti
translated: For Bhaga.

analyzed: tam gṛhītvā na sādayati
translated: Having taken it, he does not deposit it.

original: mano ha vā asya savitā tasmādidamasannam manaḥ prāṇo ha🔽vā asya savitā tasmādayamasannaḥ prāṇaḥ saṃcaratyathāha devāya savitre🔽'nubrūhītyāśrāvyāha devāya savitre preṣyeti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti nānuvaṣaṭkaroti mano
analyzed: manaḥ ha vai asya savitā tasmāt idam a sannam manaḥ prāṇaḥ ha  vai asya savitā tasmāt ayam asannaḥ prāṇaḥ saṃcarati atha āha devāya savitre  nubrūhi iti āśrāvya āha devāya savitre preṣya iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti na anuvaṣaṭkaroti mano
translated: For Savitri is his mind; therefore this mind is not set down. Savitri is his breath;🔽therefore this breath moves about. He then says, 'Recite to the god Savitri!' Having caused (the Hotri) to announce, he says, 'Prompt (the Hotri) to recite to the god Savitri!' At the Vasat-utterance he offers. He does not utter an anuvatsa.

original: ha vā asya savitā nenmano 'gnau pravṛṇajānīti prāṇo ha vā asya savitā
analyzed: ha vai asya savitā na id manaḥ gnau pravṛṇajāni iti prāṇaḥ ha vai asya savitā
translated: For Savitri is his mind; lest he should put his mind into the fire. Savitri is his breath;

analyzed: na id prāṇam agnau pravṛṇajāni iti
translated: lest he should put his breath into the fire.

original: athābhakṣitena pātreṇa /🔽vaiśvadevaṃ grahaṃ gṛhṇāti tadyadabhakṣitena pātreṇa
analyzed: atha a bhakṣitena pātreṇa  vaiśvadevam graham gṛhṇāti tat yat a bhakṣitena pātreṇa
translated: Then with the vessel which has not been used,

original: vaiśvadevaṃ grahaṃ gṛhṇāti na vai sāvitrasyānuvaṣaṭkarotyetasmādvai vaiśvadevaṃ
analyzed: vaiśvadevam graham gṛhṇāti na vai sāvitrasya anuvaṣaṭkaroti etasmāt vai vaiśvadevam
translated: he draws the cup for the Visve devâh. The reason why he draws the cup for the Visve devâh with the vessel which has not been used, is this. He does not utter an anuvatsa to the Sâvitra (cup), for from that (cup) the cup for the Visve devâh is drawn.

analyzed: graham grahīṣyan bhavati tat asya vaiśvadevena eva anuvaṣaṭkṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: He who is about to draw the cup becomes thereby consecrated by the Vaisvadeva (libation) with the Vasat call.

analyzed: yat u eva vaiśvadevam graham gṛhṇāti
translated: And, again, as to why he draws the Vaisvadeva cup.

original: mano ha vā asya savitā sarvamidaṃ viśve devā🔽idamevaitatsarvaṃ manasaḥ kṛtānukaramanuvartma karoti tadidaṃ sarvam manasaḥ
analyzed: manaḥ ha vai asya savitā sarvam idam viśve devā  idam eva etat sarvam manasaḥ kṛta anukaram anuvartma karoti tat idam sarvam manasaḥ
translated: Savitri is his mind, and all this (universe) is the Visve Devâh;

analyzed: kṛta anukaram anuvartma
translated: he thus makes all this subject to the mind, a path to the mind: and thus all this is subject to the mind, a path to the mind.

analyzed: yat u eva vaiśvadevam graham gṛhṇāti
translated: And, again, as to why he draws the Vaisvadeva cup.

original: prāṇo ha vā asya savitā sarvamidaṃ viśve devā
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ha vai asya savitā sarvam idam viśve devā
translated: Savitri is his out-breathing, and all this (universe) is the Visve Devâh;

analyzed: asmin eva etat sarvasmin prāṇa udānau dadhāti tau imau asmin sarvasmin prāṇa udānau hi  tau
translated: he thus lays the out-breathing and in-breathing into this whole (universe): and thus the out-breathing and in-breathing are laid into this whole (universe).

analyzed: yat u eva vaiśvadevam graham gṛhṇāti
translated: And, again, as to why he draws the Vaisvadeva cup.

original: vaiśvadevaṃ vai tṛtīyasavanaṃ taducyata eva🔽sāmato yasmādvaiśvadevaṃ tṛtīyasavanamucyata ṛkto 'thaitadeva yajuṣṭaḥ
analyzed: vaiśvadevam vai tṛtīyasavanam tat ucyate eva  sāmataḥ yasmāt vaiśvadevam tṛtīyasavanam ucyate ṛktaḥ tha etat eva yajuṣṭaḥ
translated: The third pressing is Vaisvadeva (belonging to all the All-gods); this is indeed said (in the Rik and Sâman Vedas);

analyzed: puraścaraṇataḥ yat etam mahāvaiśvadevam gṛhṇāti
translated: but this (is said) in the Yagus (Veda), in that he draws that great Vaisvadeva (cup).

analyzed: tam vai pūtabhṛtaḥ gṛhṇāti
translated: He draws it from the Pûtabhrit (the 'bearer of the purified Soma');

original: vaiśvadevo vai pūtabhṛdato hi devebhya unnayantyato
analyzed: vaiśvadevaḥ vai pūtabhṛt atas hi devebhyaḥ unnayanti atas
translated: for the Pûtabhrit belongs to the Visve Devâh, since from it they take (the Soma) for the gods;

analyzed: manuṣyebhyaḥ tas pitṛbhyaḥ tasmāt vaiśvadevaḥ pūtabhṛt
translated: From men, from the Fathers, therefore the Vaiśvadeva is the Pūtabhṛt.

original: taṃ vā apurorukkaṃ gṛhṇāti /🔽viśvebhyo hyenaṃ devebhyo gṛhṇāti sarvaṃ vai viśve
analyzed: tam vai a purorukkam gṛhṇāti  viśvebhyaḥ hi enam devebhyaḥ gṛhṇāti sarvam vai viśve
translated: He takes it without a Puroruc.🔽For he takes it for all the gods, and all the gods are everything,

original: devā yadṛco yadyajūṃṣi yatsāmāni sa yadevainaṃ viśvebhyo devebhyo gṛhṇāti teno
analyzed: devāḥ yat ṛcaḥ yat yajūṃṣi yat sāmāni sa yat eva enam viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ gṛhṇāti tena u
translated: whatever Ṛc verses, Yajuṣ formulas, Sāman chants there are. In that he takes it for all the gods,

analyzed: ha asya eṣa puroruṅmān bhavati tasmāt a purorukkam gṛhṇāti
translated: that is why this (offering) has a Puroruc for him. Therefore he takes it without a Puroruc.

original: athāto gṛhṇātyeva /🔽upayāmagṛhīto 'si suśarmāsi supratiṣṭhāna iti prāṇo vai suśarmā🔽supratiṣṭhāno bṛhadukṣāya nama iti prajāpatirvai bṛhadukṣaḥ prajāpataye nama
analyzed: atha atas gṛhṇāti eva  upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si su śarmā asi su pratiṣṭhānaḥ iti prāṇaḥ vai su śarmā  su pratiṣṭhānaḥ bṛhadukṣāya namaḥ iti prajāpatiḥ vai bṛhadukṣaḥ prajāpataye
translated: Now then he takes it.

original: ityevaitadāha viśvebhyastvā devebhya eṣa te yonirviśvebhyastvā devebhya iti sādayati
analyzed: iti eva etat āha viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ eṣa te yoniḥ viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ iti sādayati
translated: You are taken with a support. You are well-protected, well-established. The well-protected, well-established one is the breath. Homage to the milker of the great. Prajapati is the milker of the great. Homage to Prajapati, he says this. This is your birthplace. To the All-gods you! he places it.

original: viśvebhyo hyenaṃ devebhyo gṛhṇātyathetya prāṅupaviśati / / /🔽sa yatraitāṃ hotā śaṃsati /🔽ekayā ca daśabhiśca svabhūte dvābhyāmiṣṭaye viṃśatī ca
analyzed: viśvebhyaḥ hi enam devebhyaḥ gṛhṇāti atha itya prāṅ upaviśati 🔽sa yatra etām hotā śaṃsati 🔽ekayā ca daśabhiḥ ca sva bhūte dvābhyām iṣṭaye viṃśatī ca
translated: For he takes it for all the gods. Then he sits down facing east.

original: tisṛbhiśca vahase triṃśatā ca niyudbhirvāyaviha tā vimuñceti tadetasyāṃ🔽vāyavyāyāmṛci pātrāṇi vimucyante vāyupraṇetrā vai paśavaḥ prāṇo vai vāyuḥ prāṇena
analyzed: tisṛbhiḥ ca vahase triṃśatā ca niyudbhiḥ vāyo iha tāḥ vimuñca iti tat etasyām  vāyavyāyām ṛci pātrāṇi vimucyante vāyu praṇetrā vai paśavaḥ prāṇaḥ vai vāyuḥ prāṇena
translated: And with three and thirty teams thou carriest, O Vâyu: with those teams set free these (sacrificial vessels),--thus (saying),

analyzed: hi paśavaḥ caranti
translated: on this Vâyu-verse the vessels are set free. The teams are cattle, and Vâyu is the breath, for by the breath cattle move about.

analyzed: sa ha devebhyaḥ paśubhiḥ apacakrāma
translated: He (Indra) went away from the gods with the cattle.

analyzed: tam devāḥ prātaḥsavane nvamantrayanta sa
translated: The gods entreated him at the morning feast;

original: nopāvavarta tam mādhyandine savane 'nvamantrayanta sa ha naivopāvavarta taṃ
analyzed: na upāvavarta tam mādhyandine savane nu amantrayanta sa ha na eva upāvavarta tam
translated: he did not return to them. They entreated him at the midday feast; he did not return to them.

analyzed: tṛtīyasavane nu amantrayanta
translated: They entreated him at the evening feast.

original: sa hopāvartsyannuvāca /🔽yadva upāvarteya kim me tataḥ syāditi tvayaivaitāni pātrāṇi
analyzed: sa ha upāvartsyan uvāca  yat vaḥ upāvarteya kim me tatas syāt iti tvayā eva etāni pātrāṇi
translated: He (Indra), being about to return, said,

analyzed: yujyeran tvayā vimucyeran iti tat enena etat pātrāṇi yujyante
translated: 'If I return, what will be my reward?'--'By thee these vessels shall be yoked, and by thee they shall be unyoked.' Thus, then, by him these vessels are now yoked,

analyzed: yat aindra vāyava agrān prātaḥsavane gṛhṇāti atha enena etat pātrāṇi vimucyante yat āha
translated: when he draws the cups beginning with that for Indra and Vâyu at the morning feast; and by him these vessels are now unyoked, when he says,

original: niyudbhirvāyaviha tā vimuñceti paśavo vai niyutastatpaśubhirevaitatpātrāṇi / / /
analyzed: niyudbhiḥ vāyo iha tāḥ vimuñca iti paśavaḥ vai niyutaḥ tat paśubhiḥ eva etat pātrāṇi
translated: 'With the teams, O Vâyu, set free these (sacrificial vessels).' The teams are cattle: by means of the cattle these vessels are now unyoked.

analyzed: sa yat prātaḥsavane upāvartsyat
translated: Now, had he returned at the morning feast,

analyzed: gāyatram vai prātaḥsavanam brahma gāyatrī
translated: The morning pressing is connected with the Gayatri metre, and the Gayatri metre is Brahman.

original: brāhmaṇeṣu ha paśavo 'bhaviṣyannatha yanmādhyandine savana🔽upāvartsyadaindraṃ vai mādhyandinaṃ savanaṃ kṣatramindraḥ kṣatriyeṣu ha
analyzed: brāhmaṇeṣu ha paśavaḥ bhaviṣyan atha yat mādhyandine savana  upāvartsyat aindram vai mādhyandinam savanam kṣatram indraḥ kṣatriyeṣu ha
translated: If he had gone to the midday pressing, cattle would have been in the Brahmanas.

original: paśavo 'bhaviṣyannatha yattṛtīyasavana upāvartata vaiśvadevaṃ vai tṛtīyasavanaṃ
analyzed: paśavaḥ bhaviṣyan atha yat tṛtīyasavane upāvartata vaiśvadevam vai tṛtīyasavanam
translated: But when he went to the third pressing, the third pressing is connected with the Visve Devas,

analyzed: sarvam idam viśve devāḥ tasmāt ime sarvatra eva paśavaḥ
translated: and the Visve Devas are all this. Therefore cattle are here everywhere.

analyzed: saumyena caruṇā pracarati
translated: He proceeds with an oblation to Soma.

analyzed: somaḥ vai devānām haviḥ atha etat somāya eva haviḥ kriyate
translated: Soma is the oblation of the gods, and this is made as an oblation to Soma.

original: tathātaḥ somo 'nantarhito bhavati carurbhavati carurvai devānāmannamodano hi
analyzed: tathā atas somaḥ nantarhitaḥ bhavati caruḥ bhavati caruḥ vai devānām annam odanaḥ hi
translated: Thus Soma is not excluded. It is an oblation, for the oblation is the food of the gods, for it is cooked.

analyzed: caru rodanaḥ hi pratyakṣam annam tasmāt caruḥ bhavati
translated: The oblation is food in a manifest way. Therefore it is an oblation.

analyzed: tena na prātaḥsavane pracarati
translated: He does not proceed with it at the morning pressing,

original: na mādhyandine savana ete vai devānāṃ niṣkevalye
analyzed: na mādhyandine savane ete vai devānām niṣkevalye
translated: nor at the midday pressing, for these two pressings are the exclusive ones of the gods,

original: savane yatprātaḥsavanaṃ ca mādhyandinaṃ ca savanam pitṛdevatyo vai somaḥ / / /
analyzed: savane yat prātaḥsavanam ca mādhyandinam ca savanam pitṛ devatyaḥ vai somaḥ
translated: namely the morning pressing and the midday pressing. Soma is connected with the Pitrs.

analyzed: sa yat prātaḥsavane vā pracaret
translated: If he were to offer it at the morning pressing,

analyzed: mādhyandine vā savane samadam ha
translated: or at the midday pressing, he would cause a quarrel

original: kuryāddevebhyaśca pitṛbhyaśca tena tṛtīyasavane pracarati vaiśvadevaṃ vai
analyzed: kuryāt devebhyaḥ ca pitṛbhyaḥ ca tena tṛtīyasavane pracarati vaiśvadevam vai
translated: between the gods and the fathers. Therefore he offers it at the third pressing. The third pressing belongs to all the gods.

original: tṛtīyasavanaṃ tathā hāsamadaṃ karoti nānuvākyāmanvāha sakṛduhyeva parāñcaḥ
analyzed: tṛtīyasavanam tathā hāsamadam karoti na anuvākyām anvāha sakṛt uhya iva parāñcaḥ
translated: Thus he causes no quarrel. He does not recite an invitatory formula, for the fathers have departed once for all.

analyzed: pitaraḥ tasmāt na anuvākyām anvāha
translated: Therefore he does not recite an invitatory formula.

original: atha caturgṛhītamājyaṃ gṛhītvā /🔽āśrāvyāha ghṛtasya yajeti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti tadyā
analyzed: atha caturgṛhītam ājyam gṛhītvā  āśrāvya āha ghṛtasya yaja iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti tat yā
translated: Then, having taken ghee four times with the dipping-spoon,

original: ataḥ prācya āhutayo hutā bhavanti tābhya evaitadantardadhāti tathā hāsamadaṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: atas prācyaḥ āhutayaḥ hutāḥ bhavanti tābhyaḥ eva etat antardadhāti tathā ha asamadam karoti
translated: having caused (the sacrificer) to announce, he says (to the Hotri), 'Pronounce the offering-formula of the ghee!' and offers when the Vasat-utterance has been pronounced. That oblation which is offered here🔽before (the Sviṣṭakṛt offering) he interposes between those (oblations); thus he causes no quarrel.

analyzed: saḥ ājyasya upastīrya
translated: He then spreads ghee (in the ladle),

analyzed: dvis caroḥ avadyati atha upariṣṭāt ājyasya abhighārayati āśrāvya āha
translated: cuts two portions of the pap, and bastes them with ghee on both sides. Having caused (the sacrificer) to announce, he says (to the Hotri),

analyzed: saumyasya yaja iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti
translated: 'Pronounce the offering-formula of Soma!' and offers when the Vasat-utterance has been pronounced.

original: athāparaṃ caturgṛhītamājyaṃ gṛhītvā /🔽āśrāvyāha ghṛtasya yajeti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti
analyzed: atha aparam caturgṛhītam ājyam gṛhītvā  āśrāvya āha ghṛtasya yaja iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti
translated: Then, having taken ghee four times with the dipping-spoon,🔽having caused (the sacrificer) to announce, he says (to the Hotri), 'Pronounce the offering-formula of the ghee!' and offers when the Vasat-utterance has been pronounced.

original: tadyā ata ūrdhvā āhutīrhoṣyanbhavati tābhya evaitadantardadhāti tathā hāsamadaṃ
analyzed: tat yāḥ atas ūrdhvāḥ āhutīḥ hoṣyan bhavati tābhyaḥ eva etat antardadhāti tathā ha asamadam
translated: That oblation which he is about to offer here afterwards he interposes between those (oblations); thus he causes no quarrel.

original: karoti sa yadi kāmayetobhayataḥ pariyajedyadyu kāmayetānyatarataḥ pariyajet / / /
analyzed: karoti sa yadi kāmayeta ubhayatas pariyajet yadi u kāmayeta anyataratas pariyajet
translated: If he wishes to, he may offer on both sides; if he wishes, he may offer on one side only.

analyzed: atha pracaraṇī iti sruc bhavati
translated: Then there is the Pravarani ladle.

analyzed: tasyām caturgṛhītam ājyam gṛhītvā adhvaryuḥ
translated: Having taken ghee in four ladlings in that (ladle), the Adhvaryu

analyzed: śālākaiḥ dhiṣṇyān vyāghārayati tat yat ālākaiḥ dhiṣṇyān vyāghārayati yat eva enān adaḥ devā
translated: sprinkles the Dhisnya mounds with the Sala-twigs. In that he sprinkles the Dhisnya mounds with the Sala-twigs, (it is) because the gods

original: abruvaṃstṛtīyasavane vo ghṛtyāhutiḥ prāpsyati na saumyāpahṛto hi
analyzed: abruvan tṛtīyasavane vaḥ ghṛtya āhutiḥ prāpsyati na saumya apahṛtaḥ hi
translated: said to them, 'At the third pressing your share of ghee will arrive, not your share of Soma, for your Soma-drink has been taken away.

original: yuṣmatsomapīthastena somāhutiṃ saināneṣā tṛtīyasavana eva ghṛtyāhutiḥ prāpnoti
analyzed: yuṣmad soma pīthaḥ tena soma āhutim sā enān eṣā tṛtīyasavane eva ghṛtya āhutiḥ prāpnoti
translated: By that (ghee) you will obtain a share of the Soma-offering.' This is that share of ghee which arrives at the third pressing,

analyzed: na saumyāḥ yacā alākaiḥ dhiṣṇyān vyāghārayati tān etaiḥ eva yajurbhiḥ yathopakīrṇam
translated: not of Soma, in that he sprinkles the Dhisnya mounds with the Sala-twigs. With those very formulas he sprinkles them as they are scattered,

analyzed: yathāpūrvam vyāghārayati mārjālīye eva uttamam
translated: in the reverse order, the Marjaliya being the last.

original: taddhaike / āgnīdhrīye punarāghārayantyudagna idaṃ karmānusaṃtiṣṭhātā iti tadu
analyzed: tat ha eke āgnīdhrīye punar āghārayanti udagne idam karma anusaṃtiṣṭhātai iti tat u
translated: There (the priests) scatter (ghee) again in the Agnidhra fire, saying, 'Let this rite be completed towards the north.'

analyzed: tathā na kuryāt mārjālīyaḥ eva uttamam
translated: But let him not do so in that way; the Marjaliya is the last.

analyzed: sa yatra adhvaryuḥ
translated: Where the Adhvaryu

analyzed: śālākaiḥ dhiṣṇyān vyāghārayati tat pratiprasthātā pātnīvatam graham
translated: With the Sālākāri formulas he besprinkles the Dhishnya hearths; then the Pratiprasthātṛ draws the Pātnīvata cup.

original: gṛhṇāti yajñādvai prajāḥ prajāyante yajñātprajāyamānā mithunātprajāyante🔽mithunātprajāyamānā antato yajñasya prajāyante tadenā etadantato yajñasya
analyzed: gṛhṇāti yajñāt vai prajāḥ prajāyante yajñāt prajāyamānāḥ mithunāt prajāyante  mithunāt prajāyamānāḥ antatas yajñasya prajāyante tat enāḥ etat antatas yajñasya
translated: From the sacrifice offspring are produced; from the sacrifice being produced they are produced from the pair;🔽from the pair being produced they are produced at the end of the sacrifice. He thus produces them at the end of the sacrifice

analyzed: mithunāt prajananāt prajanayati tasmāt mithunāt prajananāt antatas yajñasya imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: from the pair for procreation. Therefore from the pair for procreation at the end of the sacrifice

analyzed: prajāyante tasmāt pātnīvatam gṛhṇāti
translated: these creatures are produced. Therefore he draws the Pātnīvata.

original: taṃ vā upāṃśupātreṇa gṛhṇāti /🔽yadi sāvitramupāṃśupātreṇa🔽gṛhṇīyādantaryāmapātreṇaitaṃ yadi sāvitramantaryāmapātreṇa🔽gṛhṇīyādupāṃśupātreṇaitaṃ samānaṃ hyetadyadupāṃśvantaryāmau prāṇo hi yo vai
analyzed: tam vai upāṃśu pātreṇa gṛhṇāti  yadi sāvitram upāṃśu pātreṇa  gṛhṇīyāt antaryāma pātreṇa etam yadi sāvitram antaryāma pātreṇa  gṛhṇīyāt upāṃśu pātreṇa etam samānam hi etat yat upāṃśu antaryāmau prāṇaḥ hi yaḥ vai
translated: He draws it in the Upāṁśu cup.

original: prāṇaḥ sa udāno vṛṣā vai prāṇo yoṣā patnī mithunamevaitatprajananaṃ kriyate / / /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ saḥ udānaḥ vṛṣā vai prāṇaḥ yoṣā patnī mithunam eva etat prajananam kriyate
translated: If he were to draw the Sāvitra in the Upāṁshu cup, he would draw this one in the Antaryāma cup; if he were to draw the Sāvitra in the Antaryāma cup, he would draw this one in the Upāṁshu cup.
